title: Data Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong> DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> <strong>Data Engineer (</strong>multiple openings)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong> Riverwoods, Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining complex data solutions for the product. Mentor and influence peers to achieve commitments on data solutions on time and with quality. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or a related field, and 36 months of experience in Sr. Associate - Projects or related.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: implementing cloud-based solutions and using Amazon Web Service (AWS) knowledge to provide cloud solutions in platform strategies; creating AWS serverless solutions for data conversion and unstructured data transfers; analyzing complex infrastructure data granularities, data visualization, iterative prototyping, and analysis tools to define architecture and develop high performance cloud-based solutions; working with large-scale data transformation and data modernization; and analyzing requirements and creating technical designs.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls.  Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between to . Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Python Developer / Data Engineer
description: <strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>Founded in 1980 as Aardvark Financial, TransMarket Group (TMG) is a privately held global markets proprietary trading firm with offices in Chicago, Puerto Rico, and Switzerland. We use next-generation technology to capture opportunities around the world and manage risk in financial markets. Our mission is to bless others through the services we provide and through the generous stewardship of the wealth we create.<br><br>TMG is a well-established and profitable business as a respected member of the global financial system for over 40 years, but also is like a startup because the potential of our group is at least one order of magnitude greater than what we are currently producing. We have an entrepreneurial culture and collaboratively develop our business with patience and discipline; we work hard, learn constantly, and relentlessly improve our expertise.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Support and enhance the firm's non-latency systems and data mart. This hands-on role will collaborate with all departments at TransMarket Group to complete goals in the following areas: Finance, risk, accounting, compliance, clearing, operations, portfolio financing. </li><li>Design, implement, and support software solutions that provide a unique insight into the firm's operations</li><li>Work with various teams across the firm to understand system requirements and needs</li><li>Quickly respond to ad hoc data and reporting requests</li><li>Enhance existing surveillance and alerting infrastructure<br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>BA/BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related experience</li><li>Strong knowledge of Python required; Pandas is a plus</li><li>Database design and support is a plus, basic SQL required</li><li>Knowledge of RESTful API design</li><li>Solid understanding of data structures &amp; containers</li><li>Basic Linux and source control (git) understanding</li><li>Familiarity with data warehousing and mining</li><li>Dashboard design and data visualization a plus</li><li>This position requires physical presence and is onsite (no remote work)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong>We offer one of the most generous profit sharing programs in the industry because we believe our employees should be able to take part in our rapid growth and success. We are proud to offer more world-class benefits for our full-time employees and their families.<br><br><em>TransMarket Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.</em>

title: Data Center Systems Engineer
description: <p><strong>Position Overview:<br><br></strong></p><p>As an entry level Programmatic Campaign Analyst, you will be introduced to the execution of programmatic campaigns utilizing our proprietary technology platform.  The role involves a combination of data analysis, creative problem-solving, and cross-team collaboration to ensure campaign success and client satisfaction.  It is expected that through our training program and hands-on experience that a Programmatic Campaign Associate will demonstrate the potential to become a Yield Manager at AdTheorent. As part of the Yield team, your official title will be Yield Analyst. <br><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities Include:<br><br></strong></p><ul> <li>Learn and develop skills for management of campaign performance, campaign delivery, and campaign profitability.</li> <li>Apply data analysis to execute advertising campaigns based on client objectives.</li> <li>Develop actionable insights and make recommendations to internal Client Services team.</li> <li>Monitor and analyze reporting on a frequent basis to ensure optimal delivery and performance of campaigns</li> <li>Work with Data Science team to improve performance for campaigns.</li> <br><br></ul><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><p><br><br><br></p><ul> <li>College degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Business.</li> <li>Excellent time management and creative problem solving skills.</li> <li>Can thrive in a fast-paced and high-growth work environment.</li> <li>Ability to translate business concepts to online marketing strategies, and vice versa.</li> <li>Team player with good communication and collaboration skills.</li> <li>Fluent in Excel.</li> <br><br></ul><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong><p>We offer full health coverage, generous PTO, an award-winning office culture!<br><br></p><p>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to foster community, inclusion and diversity within the organization. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of racial, religious, sexual or gender identity, to apply.</p>

title: Programmatic Campaign Analyst - Chicago
description: <strong>About Ascendion</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees.</li><li>Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients.</li><li>Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next. Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life</li><li>We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:</li><li>Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands</li><li>Solve complex problems – and learn new skills</li><li>Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients</li><li>Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience a community of change makers!</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse.</li><li>The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.</li><li>Position Details: </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Client: Airlines</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Title: Data Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: 06 months possible extension</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL WFH (onsite as per requirement)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Required Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 5+ years of experience in data engineering or ETL development role</li><li> Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.</li><li> Strong analytic skills related to working with structure, semi- structure, and unstructured datasets.</li><li> Experience with Big Query, SQL server, etc.</li><li> Experience with AWS cloud services: Redshift, S3, Athena, etc.</li><li> Experience with SQL and various database interface tools: SSMS, Oracle SQL developer, etc.</li><li> Passionate about solving problems through data and analytics, and creating data products including data models</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>In this role you will partner with various teams to define and execute data acquisition, storage, transformation, processing and make data actionable for operational and analytics initiatives that create sustainable revenue and share growth. This role requires expertise in company’s data sources and technology business intuition, and a working knowledge of data transformation and analytical tools.<p><br></p><ul><li> Manage data integration and technology projects across the various platforms that comprise company's data strategy</li><li> Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.</li><li> Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.</li></ul>

Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse.</li><li>The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.</li><li>Position Details: </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Client: Airlines</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Title: Data Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: 06 months possible extension</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL WFH (onsite as per requirement)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Required Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 5+ years of experience in data engineering or ETL development role</li><li> Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.</li><li> Strong analytic skills related to working with structure, semi- structure, and unstructured datasets.</li><li> Experience with Big Query, SQL server, etc.</li><li> Experience with AWS cloud services: Redshift, S3, Athena, etc.</li><li> Experience with SQL and various database interface tools: SSMS, Oracle SQL developer, etc.</li><li> Passionate about solving problems through data and analytics, and creating data products including data models</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>In this role you will partner with various teams to define and execute data acquisition, storage, transformation, processing and make data actionable for operational and analytics initiatives that create sustainable revenue and share growth. This role requires expertise in company’s data sources and technology business intuition, and a working knowledge of data transformation and analytical tools.<p><br></p><ul><li> Manage data integration and technology projects across the various platforms that comprise company's data strategy</li><li> Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.</li><li> Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.</li></ul>

title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Company Overview<br><br></strong>At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.<br><br>As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.<br><br>At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.<br><br><strong>Department Overview<br><br></strong>Motorola Solutions, Inc.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br></strong><ul><li>Design and implement highly scalable and reliable cloud-based platform solutions. </li><li>Design and develop software solutions for complex business problems in Salesforce. </li><li>Conduct code reviews to ensure the quality and maintainability of the codebase. </li><li>Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions. </li><li>Mentor junior team members and provide guidance on technical best practices. </li><li>Provide technical analysis and solutions to issues and technical direction to the team. </li><li>Telecommuting permitted 2 to 3 days per week from anywhere within the U.S. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Basic Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Masters degree + 1 years experience. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Travel Requirements<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Relocation Provided<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Position Type<br><br></strong>Experienced<br><br><strong>Referral Payment Plan<br><br></strong>No<br><br><strong>Our U.S. Benefits include:<br></strong><ul><li>Incentive Bonus Plans</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision benefits</li><li>401K with Company Match</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Generous Paid Time Off Packages</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Paid Parental &amp; Family Leave</li><li>and more!<br><br></li></ul><em><strong>EEO Statement<br><br></strong></em>Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

title: Salesforce Developer
description: NO SPONSORSHIP<p><br></p><strong> Data Quality Test Engineer</strong><p><br></p>LOCATION: CHICAGO, IL<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will be local and possibly open to contract-to-hire down the road.<p><br></p><strong>Second choice is fully remote</strong><p><br></p>Duration: Minimum one year<p><br></p>SELLING POINTS: Must be solid in SQL Database implementation new features improvement of existing functionality for data architecture projects. Integration testing, customer data quality, testing data verification, regression testing.<p><br></p>The Test Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of new features as well as improvement of existing functionality for data architecture projects. This includes Integration testing, Customer Data Quality testing, Data verification testing, Regression testing etc.<p><br></p>This is a hands-on testing position which requires deep knowledge and understanding of all aspects of developing and executing Back End testing. The Test Engineer must be an advocate for all things Testing and Quality Assurance while driving and implementing best practices. The ideal candidate must possess strong analytical and critical thinking abilities. Data testing skills are required.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree</li><li>Hands-on experience using SQL queries for results validation and data mining.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Planning and Manual test execution.</li><li>Experience in Regression Test Strategies, Regression suite maintenance and execution.</li><li>At least 3-5 years of professional experience on a variety of projects in Test Strategy, Test Design, Test Execution analysis &amp; reporting.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Jira, ALM, TFS/ADO or similar systems of record.</li><li>Understanding of Development and Test cycles, including respective best practices.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Agile and Waterfall methodologies.</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot issues, identifying root causes and support development team in development of resolutions.</li><li>Strong communication and Client/Business interfacing and interpersonal skills are a must.</li></ul>

The ideal candidate must possess strong analytical and critical thinking abilities. Data testing skills are required.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree</li><li>Hands-on experience using SQL queries for results validation and data mining.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Planning and Manual test execution.</li><li>Experience in Regression Test Strategies, Regression suite maintenance and execution.</li><li>At least 3-5 years of professional experience on a variety of projects in Test Strategy, Test Design, Test Execution analysis &amp; reporting.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Jira, ALM, TFS/ADO or similar systems of record.</li><li>Understanding of Development and Test cycles, including respective best practices.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Agile and Waterfall methodologies.</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot issues, identifying root causes and support development team in development of resolutions.</li><li>Strong communication and Client/Business interfacing and interpersonal skills are a must.</li></ul>

title: SQL Database Quality Test Engineer
description: <strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>Founded in 1980 as Aardvark Financial, TransMarket Group (TMG) is a privately held global markets proprietary trading firm with offices in Chicago, Puerto Rico, and Switzerland. We use next-generation technology to capture opportunities around the world and manage risk in financial markets. Our mission is to bless others through the services we provide and through the generous stewardship of the wealth we create.<br><br>TMG is a well-established and profitable business as a respected member of the global financial system for over 40 years, but also is like a startup because the potential of our group is at least one order of magnitude greater than what we are currently producing. We have an entrepreneurial culture and collaboratively develop our business with patience and discipline; we work hard, learn constantly, and relentlessly improve our expertise.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Ownership over our data center infrastructure, tasked with all aspects of keeping it up and operating in an optimal and reliable manner</li><li>Contacting third-party vendors about remote equipment installation and maintenance and then supervising those projects through completion</li><li>Performing hardware installation and troubleshooting existing hardware</li><li>Documenting both new and established procedures to establish and foster best practices firmwide</li><li>Cooperating with other engineers to provide stable and secure deployments of new infrastructure components</li><li>Working with network engineers to reliably upgrade and replace old network equipment</li><li>Developing an automated provisioning system and keeping the inventory system up to date</li><li>Troubleshooting software issues that might be related to hardware failures</li><li>Providing in-office hardware support</li><li>Working as part of an in-office team to collaborate directly with our experienced traders and technologists on brainstorming and implementing creative solutions to a wide range of problems<br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>BA/BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related experience</li><li>2+ years of experience in related field</li><li>Hands-on experience cabling, racking, and installing bare metal servers, network devices, and network cards</li><li>Experience with remote management tools for servers (iDrac, iLO)</li><li>Understanding of automated provisioning tools (PXE, Foreman) and ability to create installation files (kickstart, preseed)</li><li>Experience with Linux at the administration level (Debian, CentOS)</li><li>Working experience with Windows is a plus</li><li>Practical knowledge of inventory tools (Netbox)</li><li>Good understanding of monitoring tools (Icinga2, Grafana, ELK)</li><li>Experience with infrastructure management tools (Ansible, Puppet)</li><li>Good management skills with ticketing and documentation tools (Jira, Confluence)</li><li>Experience with scripting and automation (Python, Bash or other) is a plus</li><li>Experience in a low latency environment a strong plus, e.g., Solarflare, Onload, PTP<br><br></li></ul><strong>Additional Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Flexibility to occasionally work outside of core business hours and on weekends. </li><li>Ability to travel and provide support to other regions occasionally as needed. </li><li>This position requires physical presence and is onsite (no remote work)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong>We offer one of the most generous profit sharing programs in the industry because we believe our employees should be able to take part in our rapid growth and success. We are proud to offer more world-class benefits for our full-time employees and their families.<br><br><em>TransMarket Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.</em>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>Responsible for all aspects of the x86 hardware and software lifecycle for Virtual and Windows server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to VMware and Windows operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, HCIS and x86 hardware solutions. Works in agile product delivery team. Interfaces with Product Owner, Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support </li><li>Experience supporting Microsoft Windows Server technologies</li><li>Installation, configuration, and administration of virtualization infrastructures running on VMware suite of products</li><li>Experience with x86 and HCIS platforms (Nutanix, Cisco UCS)</li><li>Strong Powershell or Ansible scripting experience, especially with the goal of automation</li><li>Experience working under a Change Management umbrella, with strong policies and approval chain</li><li>Able to demonstrate a strong engineering mindset throughout the project lifecycle</li><li>Able to take responsibility and will pro-actively look to identify and improve existing processes and practices within the environment</li><li>Excellent Communication skills (spoken/written English) are a must, strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Must be able to multi-task and respond effectively under pressure</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Windows, VMware</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>Company Overview<br><br></strong>At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.<br><br>As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.<br><br>At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.<br><br><strong>Department Overview<br><br></strong>Motorola Solutions, Inc.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br></strong><ul><li>Develop and support configurations, commerce, integrations, reports, workflow, and custom development in Oracle CPQ environment. </li><li>Complete complex programs to translate requirement specifications into code. </li><li>Provide technical design to business solutions and test the modules. </li><li>Conduct solutions presentations and obtain business acceptance to solution design. </li><li>Apply application-specific technical skills to independently produce deliverables. </li><li>Acquire and utilize more in-depth business knowledge to support the applications. </li><li>Plan, document, and execute unit test plans to ensure all code changes meet requirements, and specifications. </li><li>Support programming changes during quality assurance, user acceptance testing, and post implementation to ensure the integrity of application. </li><li>Respond to questions, research and resolve issues to provide technical support for production applications. </li><li>Telecommuting permitted from anywhere within the U.S. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Basic Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelors degree + 4 years experience. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Travel Requirements<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Relocation Provided<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Position Type<br><br></strong>Experienced<br><br><strong>Referral Payment Plan<br><br></strong>No<br><br><strong>Our U.S. Benefits include:<br></strong><ul><li>Incentive Bonus Plans</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision benefits</li><li>401K with Company Match</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Generous Paid Time Off Packages</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Paid Parental &amp; Family Leave</li><li>and more!<br><br></li></ul><em><strong>EEO Statement<br><br></strong></em>Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

title: Oracle CPQ Developer
description: <p>469-436-3513 /&nbsp;jeya@selsoftinc.com</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Hi,</p><p>Greetings from Selsoft Inc,</p><p><br></p><p><span>Role:</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;EDI X12/Oracle SOA B2B/SOA/ODI Developer</p><p><span>Location:</span> Chicago, IL (Onsite 3 days per week)</p><p><br></p><p><span>JD:</span></p><p><br></p><p><span> The EDI X12/Oracle SOA B2B/SOA/ODI Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions for a variety of clients. The ideal candidate will have expertise in EDI X12/EDIFACT standards and experience working with B2B integrations in Oracle SOA. They will also have experience with Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) and the ability to work with complex data mappings and transformations.</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><u>Key Responsibilities:</u></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Design, develop, test, and maintain Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Develop EDI X12 mapping and document specifications</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Create and configure B2B trading partner agreements in Oracle SOA</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Build and configure SOA composites for data integration</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Develop complex data mappings and transformations in ODI</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Collaborate with other developers and stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects</span></p><p><u>Qualifications:</u></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At least 5-7 years of experience in developing Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Expertise in EDI X12 standards and B2B integrations in Oracle SOA</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experience with Oracle Data Integrator (ODI)</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong understanding of XML, XSD, XSLT, SOAP, REST, and WSDL</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Proficiency in SQL and PL/SQL</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experience with Agile development methodologies</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills</span></p><p><span>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong communication and collaboration skills--</span></p><p><span>Thanks &amp; Regards,</span></p><p><span> </span><span>Jeyakrishnan.K</span></p>

title: ODI & SOA developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with the following tools: AppDynamics, Datadog, New Relic and Insta</li><li>Application development experience, Kubernetes knowledge</li><li>Experience administering Infrastructure tools as well as installations.</li><li>Hands-on experience with UNIX and or/SQL</li><li>Experience in scripting and automation tools such as Python, PowerShell or Bash</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment.</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong><strong>Work. Serve. Thrive.<br><br></strong>Imagine a place where your talent can make a meaningful difference in peoples' lives. Working at Feeding America is a uniquely rewarding experience in which our employees work together as vital parts of a much larger mission. We are innovative, mission-focused, diverse, collaborative, values-driven and focused on results.<br><br>Feeding America is the nation’s second largest charity and the leading domestic hunger-relief charity in the United States. Our mission is to feed America's hungry through a nationwide network of member food banks and engage our country in the fight to end hunger.<br><br>Learn more about Feeding America <u>here</u> .<br><br>This position is a fully remote position.<br><br><strong>The Opportunity<br><br></strong>The Salesforce Developer will be the primary technical developer and heavily involved in maintaining applications deployed within Feeding America’s donor management CRM (NGO Connect, based on Salesforce platform). This individual will coordinate specifications and deliverables with business partners plus design, assess, code, configure and troubleshoot NGOC (Salesforce). They will participate in system testing to ensure successful delivery to the business in a timely and accurate fashion. Additionally, they will participate in Salesforce development activities during our on-going system migration.<br><br><strong>Salary Range</strong><strong>: $80,000 to $100,000+ Based on Experience<br><br></strong><strong>Responsibilities:<br><br></strong><ul><li> Design, develop and maintain features and configurations within Feeding America’s Salesforce Orgs, in conjunction with internal staff and external partners, with attention to long-term organizational needs. </li><li> Participate in all aspects of Salesforce releases, including feature review and impact analysis, planning, designing, building, testing, deploying, supporting, and documenting. </li><li> Develop bug fixes and functionality for FANO’s main donor management Salesforce system (NGOC), as well as related Salesforce applications, such as Drawloop (Nintex), Rollup Helper, FormAssembly and others. </li><li> Troubleshoot issues, provide recommendations, and implement solutions and best practices in the areas of data integrity standards, data quality and overall Salesforce system usage. </li><li> Assist Salesforce administrators with the configuration and support of the Salesforce Orgs, as well as related Salesforce applications. </li><li> Develop in-code test procedures to provide adequate test coverage within Salesforce org; Collaborate </li><li> with testers and end-users during QA and UAT. </li><li> Support users regarding system functionality, enhancements, system configuration and best practices. </li><li> Assist in managing live production activity and participate in efforts to resolve production incidents. </li><li> Take positive action and accountability for assigned work. </li><li> Contribute to internal technical change management best practices in CRM applications, as needed. <br><br></li></ul> <strong>Required Experience and Qualifications:</strong><ul><li> 5+ years Salesforce Developer experience</li><ul><li> C lear understanding of declarative tools available within Salesforce – validation rules, approval processes, workflows </li><li> Well versed with Profiles, Permission Sets and Role Hierarchy </li><li> Working experience with Apex </li><li> Well versed with Visualforce (Page, Component &amp; Controllers), Apex Triggers, Batch Apex, Apex Classes, Apex Test Classes </li></ul><li> Salesforce Certified Advanced Administrator and/or Certified Developer a plus </li><li> Experience with complex Salesforce implementations and integrations </li><li> Working understanding of business tools and platforms (familiarity with NetSuite, Informatica, SharePoint, and/or Tableau a plus) </li><li> Experience working within SDLC, including Waterfall and Agile methodologies </li><li> Extensive hands-on software troubleshooting experience </li><li> Experience at working effectively both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment </li><li> Preferred experience:</li><ul><li> Java, HTML, XML, CSS, Javascript </li><li> Familiarity with NGO Connect (NGOC) </li><li> Experience with online fundraising platforms (EveryAction) </li><li> Understanding of nonprofit organizations <br><br></li></ul></ul> <strong>Foundational Requirements<br><br></strong><ul><li> Mission Focused: Demonstrates a commitment to Feeding America’s mission through work and action. Is committed to people keep people facing hunger at the center of our work and strives to translate this commitment into action on a daily basis. Willing to advocate for people facing hunger and serve as an ambassador for Feeding America inside and outside of work. </li><li> Embraces Equity, Diversity and Inclusion: Demonstrates a personal commitment to valuing different background and life experiences through word and action. Takes personal actions to build an inclusive culture that ensures everyone can fully contribute based on their unique talents, skills and perspectives and feels welcomed and valued. Commits to driving equitable solutions to address root cause issues by incorporating an equity framework in their daily work. Committed to continuous personal EDI development. <br><br></li></ul> <strong>Required Leadership Competencies:<br><br></strong><ul><li> Leverages Functional Expertise : Uses advanced functional knowledge to shape decisions and plans. Takes initiative to stay current and apply knowledge of own field, including to improve processes, practices, and policies. Regularly offers to share functional expertise with others to help them succeed. </li><li> Collaborates Internally and Externally: Forms and sustains effective working relationships that accelerate goal achievement by reaching out to and engaging people from other functions or from outside the organization. Coordinates projects and plans with others within and outside of own area to ensure the work goes smoothly. Pursues networking opportunities and encourages others to form new relationships that benefit all parties. Handles conflict directly and adeptly, respecting all points of view, and resolves issues to create a united path forward. </li><li> Continuously Improves: Develops solutions that incorporate new ideas and best practices from other departments or outside the organization. Leverages continuous improvement tools and mindset when designing and implementing projects and processes. Shares and applies learning from both successful and unsuccessful ideas to inspire creative thinking. </li><li> Communicates Effectively: Conveys clear and effective messages using verbal and written communication within individual, small group, and formal presentation settings. Communicates project/operating priorities and updates to key stakeholder audiences that may include staff, network food bank members, donors, and other groups. Responds positively to requests to share information while maintaining confidentiality of sensitive content. Adjusts message and content based on feedback provided. </li><li> Manages for Results/Delegates Effectively : Holds self and others accountable for meeting measurable goals and performance expectations. Identifies multiple ways to achieve results, takes decisive action, and brings projects to completion in the timeline expected. Establishes regular status checks to maintain and report progress toward goals. Provides helpful, supportive feedback to others. Engages those closest to a situation to make decisions or recommendations. <br><br></li></ul><strong> Feeding America recognizes and values diversity. Our goal is to attract, develop, retain, and promote a talented diverse workforce where all employees feel a sense of belonging and contribute to a culture that values differences, ideas, and experiences. We intentionally seek out diverse perspectives and skills on our teams, knowing that it makes us stronger as an organization and better equipped to serve our neighbors in need. We encourage individuals from historically under-represented communities and individuals with lived experience of hunger to apply.</strong>

Collaborate </li><li> with testers and end-users during QA and UAT. </li><li> Support users regarding system functionality, enhancements, system configuration and best practices. </li><li> Assist in managing live production activity and participate in efforts to resolve production incidents. </li><li> Take positive action and accountability for assigned work. </li><li> Contribute to internal technical change management best practices in CRM applications, as needed. <br><br></li></ul> <strong>Required Experience and Qualifications:</strong><ul><li> 5+ years Salesforce Developer experience</li><ul><li> C lear understanding of declarative tools available within Salesforce – validation rules, approval processes, workflows </li><li> Well versed with Profiles, Permission Sets and Role Hierarchy </li><li> Working experience with Apex </li><li> Well versed with Visualforce (Page, Component &amp; Controllers), Apex Triggers, Batch Apex, Apex Classes, Apex Test Classes </li></ul><li> Salesforce Certified Advanced Administrator and/or Certified Developer a plus </li><li> Experience with complex Salesforce implementations and integrations </li><li> Working understanding of business tools and platforms (familiarity with NetSuite, Informatica, SharePoint, and/or Tableau a plus) </li><li> Experience working within SDLC, including Waterfall and Agile methodologies </li><li> Extensive hands-on software troubleshooting experience </li><li> Experience at working effectively both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment </li><li> Preferred experience:</li><ul><li> Java, HTML, XML, CSS, Javascript </li><li> Familiarity with NGO Connect (NGOC) </li><li> Experience with online fundraising platforms (EveryAction) </li><li> Understanding of nonprofit organizations <br><br></li></ul></ul> <strong>Foundational Requirements<br><br></strong><ul><li> Mission Focused: Demonstrates a commitment to Feeding America’s mission through work and action. Is committed to people keep people facing hunger at the center of our work and strives to translate this commitment into action on a daily basis. Willing to advocate for people facing hunger and serve as an ambassador for Feeding America inside and outside of work. </li><li> Embraces Equity, Diversity and Inclusion: Demonstrates a personal commitment to valuing different background and life experiences through word and action. Takes personal actions to build an inclusive culture that ensures everyone can fully contribute based on their unique talents, skills and perspectives and feels welcomed and valued. Commits to driving equitable solutions to address root cause issues by incorporating an equity framework in their daily work. Committed to continuous personal EDI development. <br><br></li></ul> <strong>Required Leadership Competencies:<br><br></strong><ul><li> Leverages Functional Expertise : Uses advanced functional knowledge to shape decisions and plans. Takes initiative to stay current and apply knowledge of own field, including to improve processes, practices, and policies. Regularly offers to share functional expertise with others to help them succeed. </li><li> Collaborates Internally and Externally: Forms and sustains effective working relationships that accelerate goal achievement by reaching out to and engaging people from other functions or from outside the organization. Coordinates projects and plans with others within and outside of own area to ensure the work goes smoothly. Pursues networking opportunities and encourages others to form new relationships that benefit all parties. Handles conflict directly and adeptly, respecting all points of view, and resolves issues to create a united path forward. </li><li> Continuously Improves: Develops solutions that incorporate new ideas and best practices from other departments or outside the organization. Leverages continuous improvement tools and mindset when designing and implementing projects and processes. Shares and applies learning from both successful and unsuccessful ideas to inspire creative thinking. </li><li> Communicates Effectively: Conveys clear and effective messages using verbal and written communication within individual, small group, and formal presentation settings. Communicates project/operating priorities and updates to key stakeholder audiences that may include staff, network food bank members, donors, and other groups. Responds positively to requests to share information while maintaining confidentiality of sensitive content. Adjusts message and content based on feedback provided. </li><li> Manages for Results/Delegates Effectively : Holds self and others accountable for meeting measurable goals and performance expectations. Identifies multiple ways to achieve results, takes decisive action, and brings projects to completion in the timeline expected. Establishes regular status checks to maintain and report progress toward goals. Provides helpful, supportive feedback to others. Engages those closest to a situation to make decisions or recommendations. <br><br></li></ul><strong> Feeding America recognizes and values diversity. Our goal is to attract, develop, retain, and promote a talented diverse workforce where all employees feel a sense of belonging and contribute to a culture that values differences, ideas, and experiences. We intentionally seek out diverse perspectives and skills on our teams, knowing that it makes us stronger as an organization and better equipped to serve our neighbors in need. We encourage individuals from historically under-represented communities and individuals with lived experience of hunger to apply.</strong>

description: <strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com.<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant’s QEA Practice<br><br></u></strong>We are the largest Quality Assurance Practice Globally servicing 800+ Clients including 50+ clients in Fortune 100. We bring the industry leading vision and expertise to help with Quality Engineering transformation journey for our reputed clients. We provide Next Gen QA offerings like System Modernization assurance, Business Process Assurance, Quality Engineering, Cloud Platform Assurance, Customer Experience Assurance and Robotic Test Automation. We have been ranked #1 for Market Impact by Everest Group for four times in a row and ranked #1 for completeness of vision, test advisory and Digital Business Assurance in Gartner Magic Quadrant.<br><ul><li>Strong knowledge in Finacle L1/L2 support , Finacle scripting, Unix, Finacle Development and customization knowledge ,understanding of EOD/BOD process ,Knowledge on Finacle Batches,</li><li>Familiar with Finacle versions 10.x , 11.x </li><li>Identifying, Tracking and Reviewing deliverables,</li><li>Create detailed design document/technical specifications, for select projects.</li><li>Create efficient and quality code based on given specifications.</li><li>Follow product standards, quality assurance norms and guidelines.</li><li>Conduct peer reviews during coding and testing.</li><li>Log peer review defects in the appropriate tool.</li><li>Provide support to the Senior Product Specialist in defect analysis and resolution.</li><li>Participate in deployment activities like reviewing all deliverables as per the delivery checklist, preparing/reviewing deployment document and mock testing all deliverables.</li><li>Develop reusable components. </li><li>Minimum of 5+ years of finacle development experience need<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:<br><ul><li>Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance</li><li>Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) plan and contributions</li><li>Long-term/Short-term Disability</li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan<br></li></ul><strong>Disclaimer: </strong>The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.<br><br>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : May 17 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.<br><br>Applicants may be required to attend interviews in person or by video conference. In addition, candidates may be required to present their current state or government issued ID during each interview.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.

title: IAM Engineer
description: We are seeking talented individuals that are motivated to kickstart their technology career. No prior professional experience required.<br>Revature is the largest and fastest growing employer of emerging technology talent across the U.S. Come join us! As a <strong>Revature Entry Level Software Engineer</strong> you will receive on-the-job-training to become an experienced software engineer.<br><strong>Remote interviews are starting now!<br></strong><strong><u>Benefits For Entry Level Software Engineer<br></u></strong><ul><li>Launch a software engineering career with no prior experience </li><li>Learn to code on the job. that's right: we pay you to learn. </li><li>Competitive salary </li><li>Relocation assistance</li><li>Paid time off </li><li>Industry Certifications - Employer paid.</li><li>401k </li><li>Mentoring program</li><li>Career acceleration: over 72% of Revature alumni have received an additional promotion and 92% saw their salary significantly increase after launching their tech career with Revature<br></li></ul><strong><u>Entry Level Software Engineer Training Programme<br></u></strong><ul><li>Full-time, paid training </li><li>Work on real world projects in a team environment to get you enterprise-ready for placement with one of our corporate partners. </li><li>Training on the most in-demand programming skills in the job market. we work together with our corporate partners, to identify the skills that are most vital to their organisation </li><li>We're invested in your success-you'll have an employee engagement team member to support and provide you with a wide range of assistance </li><li>As a Revature employee, you'll also have access to our expansive network of like minded peers who will show you the ropes to ensure you'll rock your tech career<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We Are Looking For<br></u></strong><ul><li>College degree (Associates or Bachelors) </li><li>Must be legally authorized to work in the US </li><li>Strong desire to learn to code - No prior professional experience required.</li><li>A natural problem solver</li><li>Team player</li><li>Challenge seekers looking to develop tech skills</li><li>Adaptable</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills</li><li>Willing to relocate anywhere in the US - Relocation assistance provided <br></li></ul>Working for Revature is more than a job, we develop you into an experienced software engineer and put you on an accelerated career path. <strong>Fast track your tech career and work for a company that invests in you-whose own success is dependent on your success</strong>.<br><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity<br></strong>The Company is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, benefits, compensation and training. If you require an accommodation to work based on any of these protected factors, please notify the Human Resources Department, and the Company will evaluate the request and provide an accommodation in accordance with applicable law.<br>We seek to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws related to discrimination and will not tolerate the interference with the ability of any of the Company's employees to perform their job duties. Our policy reflects and affirms the Company's commitment to the principles of fair employment and the elimination of all discriminatory practices.

title: Finacle Developer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>About The Role:<br><br></strong>We are seeking aTechnology Operations Engineer and our Operations Team is at the intersection of trading, development, and systems administration and plays an integral part of our firms success. The team manages the deployments, scheduling, monitoring, and troubleshooting for multiple trading strategies. We are seeking an individual to help us solve complex problems and improve our processes and tools. The ideal candidate is someone with a strong sense of ownership who can anticipate challenges.Must be open to working a rotating schedule which will include US and Asia shifts.<br><br><strong><u>What Youll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Monitor the trading system and work to identify and resolve issues</li><li>Identify, diagnose and troubleshoot complex problems to keep trading online</li><li>Work with Risk and Trading desks to understand and facilitate trading requirements</li><li>Manage daily changes and communicate status to the company</li><li>Automate software distribution and deployments for Linux and Windows applications to speed up our application deployments</li><li>Build new tools to manage our system and reduce effort and errors<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong>What Were Looking For:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field</li><li>Financial industry experience is required</li><li>1-3 years of experience using, managing, or developing on Linux systems</li><li>Fluent with Windows and Linux platforms</li><li>Proficient in a scripting language, preferably Python</li><li>Comfortable with distributed version control like Git, Mercurial, or Subversion</li><li>Familiar with configuration management systems like Salt, Puppet, or Chef</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring tools, such as Solarwinds, Nagios, Cacti, etc.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks with high attention to detail in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Motivated to identify and problem solve issues in a timely manner<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Is This a Great Opportunity<br><br></u></strong>Client is a privately held global prop trading firm. Collaborative and innovative work culture. Great work life balance. Client typically moves fast throughout the interview process.<br><br><strong>Salary Type </strong>: Annual Salary<br><br><strong>Salary Min </strong>: 120000<br><br><strong>Salary Max </strong>: 140000<br><br><strong>Currency Type </strong>: US Dollars
description_json: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>About The Role:<br><br></strong>We are seeking aTechnology Operations Engineer and our Operations Team is at the intersection of trading, development, and systems administration and plays an integral part of our firms success. The team manages the deployments, scheduling, monitoring, and troubleshooting for multiple trading strategies. We are seeking an individual to help us solve complex problems and improve our processes and tools. The ideal candidate is someone with a strong sense of ownership who can anticipate challenges.Must be open to working a rotating schedule which will include US and Asia shifts.<br><br><strong><u>What Youll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Monitor the trading system and work to identify and resolve issues</li><li>Identify, diagnose and troubleshoot complex problems to keep trading online</li><li>Work with Risk and Trading desks to understand and facilitate trading requirements</li><li>Manage daily changes and communicate status to the company</li><li>Automate software distribution and deployments for Linux and Windows applications to speed up our application deployments</li><li>Build new tools to manage our system and reduce effort and errors<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong>What Were Looking For:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field</li><li>Financial industry experience is required</li><li>1-3 years of experience using, managing, or developing on Linux systems</li><li>Fluent with Windows and Linux platforms</li><li>Proficient in a scripting language, preferably Python</li><li>Comfortable with distributed version control like Git, Mercurial, or Subversion</li><li>Familiar with configuration management systems like Salt, Puppet, or Chef</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring tools, such as Solarwinds, Nagios, Cacti, etc.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks with high attention to detail in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Motivated to identify and problem solve issues in a timely manner<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Is This a Great Opportunity<br><br></u></strong>Client is a privately held global prop trading firm. Collaborative and innovative work culture. Great work life balance. Client typically moves fast throughout the interview process.<br><br><strong>Salary Type </strong>: Annual Salary<br><br><strong>Salary Min </strong>: 120000<br><br><strong>Salary Max </strong>: 140000<br><br><strong>Currency Type </strong>: US Dollars

title: Entry Level Software Engineer

title: Technology Operations Engineer
description: Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company’s new website at: http://www.WabtecCorp.com.<p><br></p>It’s not just about your career… or your job title…it’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters…do things that haven’t been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.<p><br></p>We are the doers. The leaders. The makers. Our teams are hungry to make history, acting with integrity to relentlessly improve people’s lives. It’s time to stop dreaming about the future; let’s build it together.<p><br></p>If you are interested in joining our Talent Community, please share your resume with us. When a position that matches your qualifications becomes available it’s that much easier to connect!<p><br></p>As a System Engineer, you will use all your abilities to coordinate the design, development, and deliverables of the innovative solutions we bring to the industry in great partnership with our customers. You’ll work alongside other self-starters interested in solving complex problems for our clients, delivering high-quality solutions, driving the future of Transportation and Logistics.<p><br></p>RESPONSIBILITIES:<p><br></p><ul><li>Act as the translator of customer needs and requirements, making them crystal clear to the internal teams</li><li>Be the orchestrator of a multi-function team to design, develop, test, and deliver a high-quality solution</li><li>Lead the engineering team to design, develop, test, and deliver beyond our commitments</li><li>Be a Technical Leader for the projects across global cross-functional teams (Product / Program Management, SW COE, Electrical Integration, Train Control, Office Systems, Safety, Validation and Applications Engineering) assuring “cradle to grave” success.</li><li>Be obsessed with the state-of-the-art processes, constantly improving how we work</li><li>Be smart on money decisions, managing budgets, spending, looking for cost improvement opportunities</li><li>Act as the PR of the project, kicking it off, communicating its status to the Sr Leaders and customers</li><li>As a forever learner, promote a learning environment. With postmortem analysis, fail studies, lessons learned, etc. Using them to improve next projects</li><li>Drive the knowledge management across the team, with updated documentation</li><li>Be an inspirational leader to the team, developing, coaching, and guiding the growth of other team members<br></li></ul><p><br></p>QUALIFICATIONS:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s / Master’s Degree in ECE / EEE /Computer Science / IT or in STEM Majors or equivalent </li><li>Domain expertise</li><li>3 - 6 years of work experience working as System Engineer/Product Owner/Product development</li><li>Knowledge of AAR and CENELEC Safety standards for the rail industry.<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Wabtec Corporation is committed to taking on the world’s toughest challenges. In order to fulfill that commitment we rely on a culture of leadership, diversity and inclusiveness. We aim to employ the world’s brightest minds to help us create a limitless source of ideas and opportunities. We believe in hiring talented people of varied backgrounds, experiences and styles…people like you! Wabtec Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or protected Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
