title: Microsoft Dynamics D365 Developer
description: <strong><u>Department</u></strong><p><br></p>PSD Data Science Staff<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Department</u></strong><p><br></p>The University of Chicago Data Science Institute (DSI) is a collaboration of scholars, researchers, educators, and practitioners pursuing the methodological, societal, and domain-oriented challenges of our increasingly data-centric world. The DSI is a research center setting the intellectual agenda for the field and an innovator and provider of data education at the undergraduate, graduate, and professional levels. Integral to DSI’s success includes the rewarding engagement outside the walls of the University through meaningful partnerships with industry, government, and the community.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Research Data Scientist (RDS) will work as a technical research staff member at the DSI with the primary responsibility of research focused on DSI’s efforts at the intersection of AI, Data, Medicine, and Health. This role will collaborate with the broader research programs and faculty labs at the DSI. This position will particularly focus on the development of MRI-based breast cancer risk prediction models and investigating modern computer vision and deep learning techniques' effectiveness on MRI-based breast cancer risk prediction. The Research Data Scientist will provide mentorship to Data Science Clinic student clinic teams. This role reports to the Director of Research Programs and Strategy at the DSI.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Conducts an independent research program in the RDS area of specialty as well as disseminate and publish these results.</li><li>Plans, executes, facilitates, and advances medical AI research projects.</li><li>Leads data analysis and data management on a small portfolio of research projects.</li><li>Participates in the preparation and writing of grant applications and reports, and co-authors/authors scientific research manuscripts. Provides peer review of grant applications and scientific manuscripts.</li><li>Mentors and supports graduate and undergraduate student teams within the UChicago Data Science Institute Clinic.</li><li>Supports the ongoing education, training and consulting programs at the UChicago Data Science Institute.</li><li>Delineates new directions of research, performs research and writes papers.</li><li>Presents work at scientific meetings.</li><li>Conducts data acquisitioning and cleaning.</li><li>Facilitates collaborations among the DSI research groups and performs research and writes papers as part of collaborative research projects.</li><li>Collaborates on development of new research projects with academic and community-based organizations.</li><li>Trains and mentors DSI research personnel.</li><li>Designs and evaluates statistical models and reproducible data processing pipelines using expertise of best practices in machine learning and statistical inference. Provides expertise for high level or complex data-related requests and engages other IT resources as needed. Partners with other campus teams to assist faculty with data science related needs.</li><li>Guides staff or faculty members in defining the project and applies principals of data science in manipulation, statistical applications, programming, analysis, and modeling.</li><li>Performs other related work as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong></u><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field.<p><br></p><li></li><p><br></p><strong><u>Work Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through 5-7 years of work experience in a related job discipline.<p><br></p><li></li><p><br></p><strong><u>Certifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics or related STEM field.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong background and established track record in machine learning, computer vision and medical research.</li><li>Strong scientific publication record in peer-reviewed journals and conferences in the areas of computer vision and medical research.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skills Or Knowledge</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Deep learning, computer vision, cancer research, and medical imaging.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Resume/CV (required)</li><li>Cover Letter (preferred)</li><li>References (2)(required)</li></ul><p><br></p>When applying, the document(s) <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> be uploaded via the <strong><u>My Experience</u></strong> page, in the section titled <strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong> of the application.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Family</u></strong><p><br></p>Research<p><br></p><u><strong>Role Impact</strong></u><p><br></p>Individual Contributor<p><br></p><strong><u>FLSA Status</u></strong><p><br></p>Exempt<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Frequency</u></strong><p><br></p>Monthly<p><br></p><strong><u>Scheduled</u></strong><strong><u> Weekly Hours</u></strong><p><br></p>37.5<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits Eligible</u></strong><p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><strong><u>Drug Test Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Health Screen Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Posting Statement</u></strong><p><br></p>Employees must comply with the University’s COVID-19 vaccination requirements. More information about the requirements can be found on the University of Chicago Vaccination GoForward.<p><br></p>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.<p><br></p>Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.<p><br></p>We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.<p><br></p>All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history. A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment. Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.<p><br></p>The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

title: System Engineer
description: <strong>Summary<br><br></strong>The Software Implementation Engineer participates in all phases of ensuring successful deployment of Pareto technology to benefit our clients. The Software Implementation Engineer will work on project teams to complete all technical tasks required for each client implementation – data mapping, data migration/transfer, data ingestion, data validation check and reports, processing, etc. Creates any required documentation and drives problem management &amp; resolution associated with implementation &amp; processing.<br><br><strong>Key Duties And Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Works on a project team to complete all technical tasks required for each client implementation – data mapping, data migration/transfer, data ingestion, data validation check and reports, processing, etc. </li><li>Collaborates with product and operations engineers to optimize the ingestion process, data validation checks and other processing jobs.</li><li>Creates new client portfolio documentation of all business rules and data details – schemas, rules, exceptions, etc.</li><li>Maintains Jira tasks to reflect progress on all implementation tasks and activities.</li><li>Assists with defect management resolution for ingestion and validation related processes and jobs. </li><li>Produces client facing validation reports.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Education And Experience<br></strong><ul><li>BS in a relevant discipline (computer science, MIS, engineering, etc.)</li><li>Minimum of 4 years’ experience in a role responsible for technical implementation tasks for software/products</li><li>Minimum of 2 years’ experience working with healthcare data such as medical claims, pharmacy claims, membership, or provider data </li><li>Experience using SQL, Spark, and PySpark</li><li>Experience with Tableau dashboards and the publishing process<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities<br></strong><ul><li>Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.</li><li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Excellent documentation skills.</li><li>Team player.</li><li>Ability to manage open requests and follow up when necessary without outside direction.</li><li>Ability to manage time effectively with strong attention to detail.</li><li>Ability to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.</li><li>Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.</li><li>Ability to interact politely, tactfully and firmly with a wide range of people and personalities.</li><li>Ability to work in an environment with potential interruptions.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple simultaneous tasks with individual timeframes and priorities.<br><br></li></ul><strong>WORK ENVIRONMENT<br><br></strong>Most tasks are performed in a standard office environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. Tasks involve the ability reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.<br><br><strong>DISCLAIMER<br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the typical duties and responsibilities associated with the identified job. It does not include all duties and responsibilities of the position. The listing of the duties and responsibilities are not necessarily in the order of their relative importance.<br><br><strong>Note: This position is hybrid, requiring presence in-office:<br><br></strong>Local: At least 1 day per week<br><br>Remote: 2 to 3 days per quarter<br><br><strong>About Us<br><br></strong><strong>OUR MISSION<br><br></strong>To improve health plan operations and elevate the customer experience.<br><br><strong>OUR VISION<br><br></strong>Empowering health plans to excel through technology, service and advisory experience<br><br><strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>At Convey Health Solutions, we manage a myriad of administrative needs and make it easier for health plans to operate and provide valuable experiences for their members. How so? We focus on building specific technologies and services that uniquely meet the needs of government-sponsored health plans<br><br>Are you ready to join a winning team? We want to tap into your experience and enthusiasm to help health plans streamline member management.<br><br>As a dynamic company, we offer an environment of learning, caring, and support of personal goals. Every team member is valued for his or her commitment to our cause, and for the contributions to our success.<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer

The Software Implementation Engineer will work on project teams to complete all technical tasks required for each client implementation – data mapping, data migration/transfer, data ingestion, data validation check and reports, processing, etc. Creates any required documentation and drives problem management &amp; resolution associated with implementation &amp; processing.<br><br><strong>Key Duties And Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Works on a project team to complete all technical tasks required for each client implementation – data mapping, data migration/transfer, data ingestion, data validation check and reports, processing, etc. </li><li>Collaborates with product and operations engineers to optimize the ingestion process, data validation checks and other processing jobs.</li><li>Creates new client portfolio documentation of all business rules and data details – schemas, rules, exceptions, etc.</li><li>Maintains Jira tasks to reflect progress on all implementation tasks and activities.</li><li>Assists with defect management resolution for ingestion and validation related processes and jobs. </li><li>Produces client facing validation reports.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Education And Experience<br></strong><ul><li>BS in a relevant discipline (computer science, MIS, engineering, etc.)</li><li>Minimum of 4 years’ experience in a role responsible for technical implementation tasks for software/products</li><li>Minimum of 2 years’ experience working with healthcare data such as medical claims, pharmacy claims, membership, or provider data </li><li>Experience using SQL, Spark, and PySpark</li><li>Experience with Tableau dashboards and the publishing process<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities<br></strong><ul><li>Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.</li><li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Excellent documentation skills.</li><li>Team player.</li><li>Ability to manage open requests and follow up when necessary without outside direction.</li><li>Ability to manage time effectively with strong attention to detail.</li><li>Ability to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.</li><li>Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.</li><li>Ability to interact politely, tactfully and firmly with a wide range of people and personalities.</li><li>Ability to work in an environment with potential interruptions.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple simultaneous tasks with individual timeframes and priorities.<br><br></li></ul><strong>WORK ENVIRONMENT<br><br></strong>Most tasks are performed in a standard office environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. Tasks involve the ability reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.<br><br><strong>DISCLAIMER<br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the typical duties and responsibilities associated with the identified job. It does not include all duties and responsibilities of the position. The listing of the duties and responsibilities are not necessarily in the order of their relative importance.<br><br><strong>Note: This position is hybrid, requiring presence in-office:<br><br></strong>Local: At least 1 day per week<br><br>Remote: 2 to 3 days per quarter<br><br><strong>About Us<br><br></strong><strong>OUR MISSION<br><br></strong>To improve health plan operations and elevate the customer experience.<br><br><strong>OUR VISION<br><br></strong>Empowering health plans to excel through technology, service and advisory experience<br><br><strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>At Convey Health Solutions, we manage a myriad of administrative needs and make it easier for health plans to operate and provide valuable experiences for their members. How so? We focus on building specific technologies and services that uniquely meet the needs of government-sponsored health plans<br><br>Are you ready to join a winning team? We want to tap into your experience and enthusiasm to help health plans streamline member management.<br><br>As a dynamic company, we offer an environment of learning, caring, and support of personal goals. Every team member is valued for his or her commitment to our cause, and for the contributions to our success.<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Research Data Scientist
description: There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.<p><br></p>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Location:</strong> United States (US) - Illinois - East Moline<p><br></p><strong>Function:</strong> Engineering (CA)<p><br></p><strong>Title: </strong>Senior Software Engineer - 99284<p><br></p><strong>Onsite/Remote:</strong>Onsite Position<p><br></p>This position is eligible for a flexible work schedule arrangement at the present time. The arrangement may be delayed for training or other job acclimation purposes and remains subject to change.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong></strong><p><br></p>As a <strong> Senior Software Engineer, </strong>at Global Crop Harvesting Product Design Center,you will be performing software development (C, C++, QT, Matlab/Simulink), testing, and integration of software components to control a Combine harvesting vehicle. You will also perform embedded system engineering tasks, including:<p><br></p><ul><li> Perform requirements analysis, operational concept development, software system design/architecture, component integration, design reviews, vehicle platform testing and problem solving. </li><li> Provide technical leadership and guidance for the software team’s developers and collaborate with enterprise software teams as a key stakeholder for the Combine software team. </li><li> Assign, coordinate, and review work from other engineers and support personnel. Mentor engineers within the team on embedded software work. </li><li> Analyze and drive for resolution of complex software issues. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> VISA Sponsorship is available for this position </strong><p><br></p><strong>What Skills You Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Expert in embedded software development with C/C++ programming language and/or Model Based Software Design (MBSD) using the Matlab/Simulink tool chain. </li><li> Strong technical skills in the areas of software development, hardware integration, and electrical systems. </li><li> Demonstrated leadership capability and project management skills. </li><li> Strong communication skills. </li><li> Strong troubleshooting skills. </li><li> Ability to work in a self-directed environment and mentor fellow engineers. </li><li> Knowledge of product development processes. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>What Makes You Stand Out</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with embedded operating systems and CAN communications J1939 protocol. </li><li> Experience in machine learning theory and learning algorithms. </li><li> Technical experience relating to design and diagnostics of mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic systems in Agricultural or Construction vehicles. </li><li> Experience with AUTOSAR and John Deere proprietary operating systems </li><li> Technical skills and knowledge in portable electronic design, communication bus interfaces, GPS systems, wireless communications, and mobile application development. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Get</strong><p><br></p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive reward package to help you get started on your new career path, including:<p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible work arrangements</li><li>Highly competitive base pay and performance bonuses</li><li>Savings &amp; Retirement benefits (401K and Defined Benefit Pension)</li><li>Healthcare benefits with a generous company contribution in the Health Savings Account</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Employee Assistance Programs</li><li>Tuition assistance</li><li>Fitness subsidies and on-site gyms at specific Deere locations</li><li>Charitable contribution match</li><li>Employee Purchase Plan &amp; numerous discount programs for personal use</li></ul><p><br></p>Follow this link to learn more about our Total Rewards Package https://bit.ly/3XCd8fL<p><br></p>The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.<p><br></p>The terms of the applicable benefit plans, and all company actions administering or interpreting these plans, continue to control. Deere &amp; Company reserves the right to suspend, amend, modify, or terminate the Plan(s) in any manner at any time, including the right to modify or eliminate any cost-sharing between the company and participants. Changes, which can be made at any time, are made by action of the company's board of directors, or to the extent authorized by resolution of its board of directors, or by the Deere &amp; Company Compensation Committee. In the event of a conflict between the language of the official Plan Documents and this document, the language of the official Plan Documents will control.<p><br></p>ACA Section 1557 Nondiscrimination Notice<p><br></p>The John Deere Health Benefit Plans for Salaried Employees and The John Deere Benefit Plan for Wage Employees comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex.

title: Cloud Engineer - Remote
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>As a Test Engineer, you’ll impact the lives of everyday people and help them move from surviving to thriving with digital personal finance solutions. Behind our forward-thinking technology is a group of curious, innovative problem solvers creating next-level products backed by data and consumer-centric strategy. At Achieve, you’re encouraged to explore new technologies while working on exciting projects that directly impact our member’s success.<br><br>Our Test Engineering team here at Achieve is a hard-working and dedicated group operating within each business line to help their teams deliver high quality releases on a consistent basis. We take pride in making sure the release processes are aligned with the business objectives. At Achieve, we use our updated frameworks to cover both UI/Functional and backend/API automation with the goal of automating all high priority test cases within the sprint. You will work side by side with the product and development team in an agile setup to meet company goals and objectives. We encourage our team members to take ownership of all testing activities within their teams to ensure not only solid releases but also to build highly efficient teams.

title: Software Implementation Engineer
description: <strong>Position- </strong><strong>.Net Developer Role</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location – </strong><strong>Chicago, IL </strong><strong>(</strong><strong>Hybrid 3 days in a week in an office</strong><strong>)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration –Full Time</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6-8 years of experience designing and developing applications</li><li>Hands on experience on WPF, .NET with SQL Server.</li><li>Ability to write complex stored procedures, optimizing the same</li><li>Ability to integrate with other applications using APIs</li><li>Ability to work as an independent developer</li><li>Good Analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting skills.</li><li>Good Communication skills</li><li>Should work in customer location in IL, Chicago as per their hybrid policy</li></ul> Should have got prior work experience with onsite / offshore / multiple team model based engagement and be able to collaborate well as a team member + sr.developer+ individual contributor communicating with customer stakeholder

title: Software Engineer
description: Would you like to see the impact of your work on the real world? Is hands-on world class engineering and problem-solving part of your passion? Welcome to WBA Tech.<br><br>We are a team of technologists, under our visionary CEO Rosalind Brewer, working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, affordable, easier to use, efficient, and patient-focused. Through the user of technology, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the center of everything we do. You will be part of a team that will build the future of a healthcare platform that connects customers with doctors’ offices, hospitals, care centers, pharmacies, insurers and payors. Working for WBA Tech is rewarding because your efforts will make a true difference to customers and patients across the communities we serve in the U.S.<br><br>You will be involved in algorithm design, data structure at petabyte scale, imaging and speech processing, artificial intelligence and robotics, infrastructure and network designs at a massive scale.<br><br>We look for leaders and individual contributors in front end designers, backend Java programmers, Linux engineers, network engineers, software and algorithm designers (remember the big O notation?), AI implementers, image processing engineers, database designers (SQL and NoSQL), messaging engineers and security engineers with knowledge at protocol level.<br><br>WBA is #18 on the Fortune 500 list and our company purpose is more joyful lives through better health.<br><br><strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>Builds and maintains big data pipelines to support advanced analytics and data science solutions. Uses interfaces to support data ingestion and curation frameworks. Maintains and enhances interfaces to support data platform. Identifies valuable internal and external data. Collaborates closely with data scientists to define data for the design, development, and deployment of new solutions that support business priorities. Ensures seamless integration of data across the enterprise and drives automation of the most common and repeatable processes.<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Develops software that processes, stores and serves data for use by others. </li><li>Develops data structures and pipelines to organize, collect and standardize data that helps generate insights and addresses reporting needs. </li><li>Writes ETL (Extract / Transform / Load) and ELT (Extract / Load/ Transform) processes, designs database systems and develops tools for real-time and offline analytic processing. </li><li>Develops data pipelines that are scalable, repeatable, performant and secure. </li><li>Troubleshoots software, data pipelines and processes for data consistency and integrity. </li><li>Integrates data from a variety of sources, assuring that they adhere to data quality and accessibility standards. </li><li>Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. </li><li>Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi complex information related to assigned activities. </li><li>Develops API integrations to support continuing increases in data volume and complexity. </li><li>Designs and develops data integrations and data quality framework. <br><br></li></ul>An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans<br><br><strong>About Walgreens And WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree and at least 2 years of experience in data engineering. </li><li>Experience with query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with SQL and NoSQL databases. </li><li>Experience building software processing large volumes of data and optimizing data pipelines, and data processing frameworks. </li><li>Experience with analytics related to working with datasets. </li><li>Experience establishing and maintaining key relationships with peers, business partners and leadership within a matrix organization to ensure quality standards for service. </li><li>Experience analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions. </li><li>Willing to travel up to/at least 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelors degree in a Computer Science, Computer Engineering highly preferred</li><li>Experience deploying applications developed using Java, Spring boot and Angular JS highly preferred</li><li>Experience with REST API development highly preferred</li><li>Experience in retail or healthcare industry</li><li>Experience with any of cloud providers like Azure, AWS, GCP, etc. and application deployment including pipelines, Function Apps, Logic Apps, etc. </li><li>Experience with message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores. </li><li>Experience with messaging systems such as Kafka or Azure Event Hubs</li><li>Experience with big data tools like Hadoop and\\or Spark and Tabular formats like Delta, HUDI, Iceberg</li><li>Experience with Git, merging, managing branches, and resolving conflicts. </li><li>Experience with manual/automated functional testing and unit testing. </li><li>Experience in leading, coaching, and mentoring junior members of varying skill levels. </li><li>Experience with project management practices, frameworks, and methodologies (Agile/Scrum/Waterfall)</li><li>Experience with Data Platform concepts (Data Lake, Data Warehouse, and Delta Lake/Lakehouse). General understanding of Landing, Staging area. Data Cleansing</li><li>Experience with CI/CD principles and best practices</li></ul>To review benefits, please click here jobs.walgreens.com/benefits<br><br>An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans

title: Copy of Copy of Test Engineer
description: <strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>Applies data analysis tools and techniques to provide insights and actionable recommendations for the business. Uses statistical modeling to make predictions about future outcomes in multiple scenarios to improve products &amp; processes. May explain findings to business audience.<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Responsible for applying data analysis tools and techniques to provide insights and actionable recommendations for the business. Uses statistical modeling to make predictions about future outcomes in multiple scenarios to improve products &amp; processes. May explain findings to business audience. </li><li>Assists in executing statistical and mathematical analyses to support business decision making for multiple business functions. </li><li>Uses algorithms and statistical predictive models and participates in determining analytical approaches and modeling techniques to evaluate scenarios and potential future outcomes. </li><li>Applies analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data, using advanced statistical techniques such as predictive statistical models, customer profiling, segmentation analysis, survey design and analysis and data mining. </li><li>Develops basic tests and validates hypotheses through the application of a range of advanced mathematical, statistical, scientific and/or computational techniques, such as probability models, machine learning, data mining, pattern recognition, data visualization, predictive analytics, data warehousing, artificial intelligence and/or other similarly complex methods. . </li><li>Documents assigned aspects of projects including business objectives, data gathering and processing, leading approaches, final algorithm, detailed set of results and analytical metrics. </li><li>Assists with developing materials to explain project findings. </li><li>Escalates problems and roadblocks as they occur. </li><li>Interacts with team members and peers and may interact with external peers to provide semi-routine information related to assigned tasks. </li><li>May prepare and present interpretation of findings to internal clients. </li></ul><strong>An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans<br><br></strong><strong>About Walgreens And WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree. </li><li>Knowledge of analytics, statistical or mathematical concepts and techniques. </li><li>Knowledge of analysis and data interpretation. </li><li>Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br><br></strong>This job description is to be used as a guide for accomplishing Company and department objectives, and only covers the primary functions and responsibilities of the position. It is in no way to be construed as an all-encompassing list of duties

title: Enterprise Monitoring Engineer
description: <strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>Performs and implements assignments that impact important /complicated components/processes of the specified functional area of the Technology operation. Work is received in short- and mid-term assignments that are important / complicated undertakings and regularly require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of approved methods.<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities</strong> <ul><li>Actively participates in the daily operational activities that impact important components / processes of the of the IT work function, and may include responsibilities, such as:</li><ul><li>Execution of deployment operations to monitor and improve on pre-release, upgrades and current versions of software. </li><li>Evaluating compatibility of programs with existing hardware and/or software features. </li><li>Development of protocols to support established standards. </li><li>Improving operation and monitoring of advanced or complex features. </li><li>Development of processes and interface requirements. </li><li>Data development and definition of acceptance criteria. </li></ul><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. </li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. Facilitates elimination of problems and roadblocks before they occur. </li><li>Works cross-functionally to accomplish assignments. Interacts with internal and external peers and managers to exchange complex information related to areas of specialization. </li><li>Mentors less experienced members of the team. </li><li>May assist in live site support and incident resolution that may include on-call rotation. </li></ul><strong>An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans<br><br></strong><strong>About Walgreens And WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide."<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree and at least 2 years of experience in a technical engineering role, such as software development, release management, deployment engineering, site operations, technical operations or similar OR High school / GED and at least 5 years of experience in a technical engineering role, such as software development, release management, deployment engineering, site operations, technical operations or similar. </li><li>Experience in Technology infrastructure, such as Network, Monitoring, Systems, Databases, etc. </li><li>Experience establishing &amp; maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization, in the business community &amp; with vendors. </li><li>Experience using time management skills such as prioritizing/organizing and tracking details and meeting deadlines of multiple projects with varying completion dates</li><li>Experience analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions. </li><li>Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics</li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems. </li><li>Experience with programming languages</li><li>Knowledge of IT technologies</li></ul>

title: .Net Developer Role
description: <strong>Required for Position - 1</strong>:<p><br></p>Expertise in <strong>server builds, Linux, Ansible, Cloudbolt (Huge Plus)</strong><p><br></p>Nice to have : Vmware, LDAD .<p><br></p><strong>Position 1</strong> - Ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of experience with server builds, Linux experience and ansible and/or cloud bolt experience. VM ware experience and LDAD experience would be super helpful. Currently have <strong>700 servers to build.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Required for Position - 2 :</strong><p><br></p>Expertise in <strong>Data migrations, build outs, and Configuration of applications.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Red Hat Linux , Ansible, Vmware.</strong><p><br></p>Nice to have : Virtualization<p><br></p><strong>Position 2</strong> - Ideal candidate will have at <strong>least 5 years of experience with Red Hat, Ansible, VMware would be a major plus</strong>, and virtualization experience. Standard BAU things, migrate data, build out and configure applications.<p><br></p>The IS Converged Infrastructure Engineer plans, designs, develops, implements, and troubleshoots the infrastructure technologies for IS Systems. This role provides expertise around specific technologies including Virtualization, Platform, Storage, or Back-ups. Act as the vendor interface for support of technologies. This role will evaluate and implement new technologies, policies, and procedures for business network operations. Works to implement maintenance (firmware, patching, Operating System upgrades), troubleshooting incidents, root cause analysis, and change control processes.<p><br></p><strong>Please Note :</strong> Applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender and origin.<p><br></p>Infrastructure Engineer- Remote<p><br></p>

title: Software Engineer (Data)
description: <p><strong>Job Title: Servicenow Developer </strong></p><p><strong>Client Location: Chicago, IL (hybrid)</strong></p><p><strong> Hire Type: Full Time</strong></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Primary Skills:</strong></p><p><span>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Advanced Hands-on development experience of ServiceNow scripting like Business Rule, Script includes, Fix scripts workflows, UI Action, UI Policy, Client scripts, Email Inbound</span></p><p><span>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Good experience of Service Portal and widget creation</span></p><p><span>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Very good experience of REST and SOAP based integration, scripted REST and SOAP API creation</span></p><p><span>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Implemented ServiceNow project in Domain separated instance</span></p><p><span>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experienced in implementation on ServiceNow Discovery, Service Mapping, Event Management and Orchestration use cases.</span></p>

title: Associate Data Scientist
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>At CLA we create inspired careers.<br><br></strong>We recognize that not everyone wants to grow their career in the same way. That’s why CLA exists to create opportunities. We promise to know you and help you.<br><br>CLA, one of the nation’s largest public accounting and professional services firm is currently seeking a Power Platform Developer to join our growing Enterprise Business Solutions team.<br><br><strong><u>Position Summary<br><br></u></strong>The Power Platform Developer works closely with internal IT, Digital services and our Citizen Developers to develop point solutions and drive adoption of the Power Platform. The focus of this position is to be the main point of contact for internal client application and automation requests built on the Power Platform. As a Power Platform developer and a key member of the M365 team, you will also be responsible for Platform development standards, and promoting and assisting Citizen development efforts.<br><br><strong><u>Job Functions<br></u></strong><ul><li>Functional and technical knowledge of the Power Platform (Dataverse, Apps, Flows, Bots), SharePoint, Teams and related platforms within the M365 ecosystem.</li><li>Plan, design, develop and implement Power Platform solutions following development, compliance, governance, and security best practices, working alongside internal IT development teams as well as with business units and stakeholders.</li><li>Work with teams to ensure ALM and SDLC best practices are followed.</li><li>Ability to create Components, Solutions, and develop UI/UX standards and templates.</li><li>Participate in, or lead, sessions with customers to iteratively gather and refine requirements.</li><li>Provide technical advice to team members and help drive the adoption of Power Platform cloud solutions.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>3+ years developing low-code solutions, specifically Power Apps (Canvas and Model-driven) and Power Automate</li><li>Experience with creating custom data connectors and familiarity with creating and implementing Azure app registrations.</li><li>Customization/configuration experience with SharePoint, Office 365 and MS Dynamics</li><li>Understanding of CI/CD and Azure DevOps preferred.</li><li>Knowledge of JavaScript and Azure Functions is a plus.<br></li></ul><strong>Education<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree or experience acceptable in lieu of bachelor’s degree.<br></li></ul>Equal Opportunity Employer /AA Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.<br><br>Click here to learn about your hiring rights.<br><br><strong>Wellness at CLA<br><br></strong>To support our CLA family members, we focus on their physical, financial, social, and emotional well-being and offer comprehensive benefit options that include health, dental, vision, 401k and much more.<br><br>To view a complete list of benefits click here.<br><br>

title: IT Engineer II
description: Due to expanded production of electric vehicles across vehicle sectors, the need for interoperability and enabling technology development for vehicle-grid integration and smart charge management (VGI/SCM) is evolving to support medium- and heavy-duty vehicles in workplaces, multi-vehicle charging stations and urban charging hubs.<p><br></p>This new position will be a part of the Advanced Mobility and Grid Integration Technology (AMAGIT) research section in Argonne’s Center for Transportation Research. The AMAGIT section is part of Argonne's Transportation and Power Systems (TAPS) division. The new hire will be working at Argonne’s Smart Energy Plaza, home to the laboratory’s EV Smart-Grid Interoperability Center, which is a fully renovated and repurposed gas station designed to conduct research on the integration and management of EV charging, renewables, building systems, and energy storage.<p><br></p>The embedded systems engineer designs, develops, tests, and maintains embedded systems. The engineer will identify and fix issues and work collaboratively with engineers, researchers, and others on various teams. Participate in research teams performing complex testing and development of advanced electric vehicle systems and charging infrastructure control strategies. The embedded systems engineer’s projects will support vehicle grid integration and enabling technology development.<p><br></p><strong>Position Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with C, C++, JavaScript, and Python.</li><li>Electrical engineering background with troubleshooting skills.</li><li>Ability to use DMM, oscilloscope, logic analyzer and other similar troubleshooting equipment.</li><li>Experience with EV charging communication protocols such as ISO-15118, Open Charge Point Protocol (OCPP), DIN 70121 and SAE J1772.</li><li>Professional experience in embedded systems.</li><li>Experience in leading architecture and system requirement documents.</li><li>Experience analyzing complex technical problems, diagnosing root cause and finding solutions.</li><li>Experience in trouble-shooting embedded systems and microcontroller peripherals.</li><li>Experience implementing software for all layers: driver and BSP, framework, and application.</li><li>Bachelor's &amp; 5+ yrs, Master's &amp; 3+ yrs or Doctorate &amp; 0 yrs</li><li>A successful candidate must have the ability to model Argonne’s Core Values: Impact, Safety, Respect, Integrity, and Teamwork. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Family</strong><p><br></p>Research Development (RD)<p><br></p><strong>Job Profile</strong><p><br></p>Software Engineering 2<p><br></p><strong>Worker Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Time Type</strong><p><br></p>Full time<p><br></p><em>As an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer, and in accordance with our core values of impact, safety, respect, integrity and teamwork, Argonne National Laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace that fosters collaborative scientific discovery and innovation. In support of this commitment, Argonne encourages minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment. Argonne considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, marital status, national origin, pregnancy, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em><p><br></p><em>Argonne employees, and certain guest researchers and contractors, are subject to particular restrictions related to participation in Foreign Government Sponsored or Affiliated Activities, as defined and detailed in United States Department of Energy Order 486.1A. You will be asked to disclose any such participation in the application phase for review by Argonne's Legal Department. </em><p><br></p><em>All Argonne offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes an assessment of criminal conviction history conducted on an individualized and case-by-case basis. Please be advised that Argonne positions require upon hire (or may require in the future) for the individual be to obtain a government access authorization that involves additional background check requirements. Failure to obtain or maintain such government access authorization could result in the withdrawal of a job offer or future termination of employment.</em>

The engineer will identify and fix issues and work collaboratively with engineers, researchers, and others on various teams. Participate in research teams performing complex testing and development of advanced electric vehicle systems and charging infrastructure control strategies. The embedded systems engineer’s projects will support vehicle grid integration and enabling technology development.<p><br></p><strong>Position Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with C, C++, JavaScript, and Python.</li><li>Electrical engineering background with troubleshooting skills.</li><li>Ability to use DMM, oscilloscope, logic analyzer and other similar troubleshooting equipment.</li><li>Experience with EV charging communication protocols such as ISO-15118, Open Charge Point Protocol (OCPP), DIN 70121 and SAE J1772.</li><li>Professional experience in embedded systems.</li><li>Experience in leading architecture and system requirement documents.</li><li>Experience analyzing complex technical problems, diagnosing root cause and finding solutions.</li><li>Experience in trouble-shooting embedded systems and microcontroller peripherals.</li><li>Experience implementing software for all layers: driver and BSP, framework, and application.</li><li>Bachelor's &amp; 5+ yrs, Master's &amp; 3+ yrs or Doctorate &amp; 0 yrs</li><li>A successful candidate must have the ability to model Argonne’s Core Values: Impact, Safety, Respect, Integrity, and Teamwork. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Family</strong><p><br></p>Research Development (RD)<p><br></p><strong>Job Profile</strong><p><br></p>Software Engineering 2<p><br></p><strong>Worker Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Time Type</strong><p><br></p>Full time<p><br></p><em>As an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer, and in accordance with our core values of impact, safety, respect, integrity and teamwork, Argonne National Laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace that fosters collaborative scientific discovery and innovation. In support of this commitment, Argonne encourages minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment. Argonne considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, marital status, national origin, pregnancy, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em><p><br></p><em>Argonne employees, and certain guest researchers and contractors, are subject to particular restrictions related to participation in Foreign Government Sponsored or Affiliated Activities, as defined and detailed in United States Department of Energy Order 486.1A. You will be asked to disclose any such participation in the application phase for review by Argonne's Legal Department. </em><p><br></p><em>All Argonne offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes an assessment of criminal conviction history conducted on an individualized and case-by-case basis. Please be advised that Argonne positions require upon hire (or may require in the future) for the individual be to obtain a government access authorization that involves additional background check requirements. Failure to obtain or maintain such government access authorization could result in the withdrawal of a job offer or future termination of employment.</em>

title: Infrastructure Engineer- Remote
description: <p><strong>*** MUST HAVE SAP TO BE CONSIDERED ***</strong></p> <p><strong>*No Sponsorship available for this role*</strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong><u>Summary<br></u></strong> </p> <p>The <strong>SAP </strong><strong>Data Integration (SAP ETL Developer)</strong> will possess exceptional SAP BODS ETL development skills while adhering to the established ETL architecture for solution delivery. They will assist the ETL Lead Architect with the overall data integration architecture, provide production support, resolve data integration issues, maintain, and manage overall metadata and data mapping, and participate in change control and quality assurance. </p> <p> </p> <p>The position requires a level of interest and passion for data integration, big data processing, data warehousing, reporting, and analytics.<br> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong></p> <p> </p> <p>The SAP ETL Developer will be an individual contributor and will support daily ETL production processes, including resolving data integration issues. The incumbent will also coordinate with and support analytic power users and various data source systems administrators to coordinate data integration logic of end-to-end data integration processes. Additionally, they will support the enterprise data model including updates to the enterprise data dictionary, metadata management and data quality assurance. </p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong><u>Duties</u></strong></p> <p> </p> <ul> <li>20% Deliver SLA of ETL production operation including on call duty. </li> <li>60% Deliver ETL solutions for new data integration request</li> <li>20% Maintain changes and updated of the data integration architecture, data mapping, data dictionary </li><br></ul> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong></p> <p> </p> <ul> <li>Functional/technical proficiency with at least 1+ full life cycle <strong>SAP BODS, SAP EDW, SAP HANA, Metadata Management</strong> implementations within SAP.</li> <li>Minimum 3+ years of experience developing data warehouses, data integrations, and/or big data processes with a working knowledge of data warehousing methodologies (Inmon and Kimball) methodologies, as well as knowledge of data model techniques using Erwin. </li> <li>Previous experience working with data architects / modeler and other ETL developers to assist with designing optimal data structures to support BI, reporting, dashboards, and analytical requirements</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics / Math / Computer Science / Business Analysis / Business Administration is required</li> <li>Experience with change management procedures, deployment of database changes</li> <li>Ability to focus on details and ability to identify root cause for data anomalies and data quality issues </li> <li>Excellent communication, both written and verbal</li> <li>Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment</li> <li>Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization</li> <li>Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting, Keen attention to detail</li> <li>Work hours may vary to support the Global organization</li></ul>

title: Servicenow Developer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Company: </strong>Oak Street Health<br><br><strong>Title: </strong>Engineer II - Test Engineer FE<br><br><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago/Remote<br><br><strong><u>Role Description<br><br></u></strong>Our product suite known as Canopy, is a transformative clinical operations and population health platform for value-based primary care. Coupling a high-performance tech platform with machine learning-driven analytics, Canopy enables our clinical and service teams to provide excellent care to every single patient. From facilitating the delivery of a visit in our centers to supporting patients that have been admitted to a hospital, there is not a point in the patient journey that Canopy does not touch. At Oak Street Health, you will be influential in the development of innovative products that do more than just building scalable services. Everything you do will have an immediate impact on the health and wellbeing of our patients.<br><br>As a Test Engineer FE you will have an impactful contribution in the delivery of a new kind of platform for healthcare, one built specifically for the clinical team. From design to implementation, you will partner with our stellar engineering, product, and design teams in a fast-paced, agile environment to transform ideas into a reality. Utilizing modern methodologies and open source tools, you will be empowered to push the boundaries of Quality Engineering as we seek to deliver applications that will directly and immediately impact the experience of our teams and our patients.<br><br>There is no better time to join our rapidly growing team at Oak Street Health. We can’t think of a mission any more motivating; and, with your help, we can drive change in healthcare for the patients that need us most.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Contribute in all aspects of SDLC process( SCRUM, Design, Code, Test, Deploy &amp; Maintain)</li><li>Collaborate with Product, UX and other Engineering teams</li><li>Collaborate with Platform team following Architecture best practices for scalability and reliability</li><li>Review and analyze business and system requirements / specifications</li><li>Design test plans, scenarios, scripts, and procedures</li><li>Execute test cases (manual or automated) and log test results</li><li>Work with the development and product team to correct bugs / errors and identify requirement updates / clarifications</li><li>Contribute to code review process to improve code quality</li><li>Mentor Engineers on software quality</li><li>Develop and maintain automation frameworks and solutions for consumer facing products and APIs </li><li>Automate tests to facilitate regression testing</li><li>Collaborate with engineering to build solutions on testing and automation to achieve SecDevOps best practices</li><li>Other duties as assigned. <br></li></ul><strong>What are we looking for?<br><br></strong><strong><u>We’re Looking For a Motivated Quality Engineer With<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in CS or equivalent work experience</li><li>3+ years experience in automation testing development </li><li>Proficiency with one or more of the following programming languages/frameworks - .NET/JAVA, Python</li><li>3+ years experience with testing tools like Selenium, SOAP UI, Ready API, open source tools</li><li>2+ years experience with databases and SQL </li><li>2+ years of experience building consumer-facing products using any SPA frameworks (React / Vue). Strong preference for Vue 2/3.</li><li>Takes a Design First approach to software development.</li><li>Experience writing Jest / Vitest Unit Tests and able to achieve close to 100% code coverage.</li><li>Experience working in an Agile/Devops environment</li><li>Experience working with source code and CI tools and processes </li><li>Familiarity with Azure DevOps and gRPC - Preferred</li><li>US work authorization</li><li>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br></li></ul><strong>What does being “Oaky” look like?<br></strong><ul><li>Radiating positive energy</li><li>Assuming good intentions</li><li>Creating an unmatched patient experience</li><li>Driving clinical excellence</li><li>Taking ownership and delivering results</li><li>Being relentlessly determined<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Oak Street Health?<br><br></u></strong>Oak Street Health is on a mission to “Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient’s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We’re an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody “Oaky” values and passion for our mission.<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients</li><li>Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options</li><li>Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits</li><li>Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends</li><li>New centers and flexible work environments</li><li>Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.<br><br>Learn more at <u>www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health</u>

With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody “Oaky” values and passion for our mission.<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients</li><li>Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options</li><li>Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits</li><li>Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends</li><li>New centers and flexible work environments</li><li>Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.<br><br>Learn more at <u>www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health</u>

title: Power Platform Developer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>Old National Bank was established in 1834. Today, we are the largest financial services holding company with dual headquarters in Chicago and Evansville, IN. We provide an array of services to our clients which include Commercial and Community Banking, Investments, and Wealth Management. At Old National, we believe that by helping our team members balance work life with home life, we create a more productive workforce and a stronger company.<br><br>We are looking for an experienced and versatile technical business analyst to improve our information technology systems. This Technical Business Analyst will be a member of the Wealth Management IT team mapping business requirements to appropriate technical solutions across Old National Bank Wealth Management business line functions, as well as deliver solutions to meet an array of internal and customer facing systems. This individual will be responsible for documenting existing business needs and developing new and enhanced business processes to ensure IT solutions support and align with business initiatives. Offices based in either Chicago near Rosemont, Minneapolis/St Paul area or Evansville Indiana.<br><br><strong><u>Key Accountabilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Act as IT project lead to ensure all business requirements are captured for design, testing and implementation of a variety of solutions across corporate systems needs and capabilities. </li><li> Continually seek opportunities to increase client satisfaction, deepen relationships, and effectively manage client expectations. </li><li> Work with business sponsors to determine business requirements necessary to increase efficiency and functionality of software/applications. </li><li> Design current and future state processes and assist with connecting all necessary teams together to push project from start to finish </li><li> Design workflows, processes and solutions to solve business problems. </li><li> Ensure test strategies/plans involve appropriate integration and process components. </li><li> Develop unit test cases, system integration testing and validate test results during testing. </li><li> Build a strong cross functional understanding of both the company’s products and business operations. projects. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications And Education Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Extensive experience in technical business analysis in Wealth Management or Financial Services Our people are critical to the Bank's strategy and success. In return we offer competitive compensation with our salary, structured bonus program, exceptional medical, dental, vision insurance, 5% company contribution on 401K, continuing education and a unique opportunity with a growing, client-focused and collegial company.<br><br><strong> Old National is proud to be an equal opportunity employer focused on fostering an inclusive workplace and committed to hiring a workforce comprised of diverse backgrounds, cultures and thinking styles. <br><br></strong>As such, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>We do not accept resumes from external staffing agencies or independent recruiters for any of our openings unless we have an agreement signed by the Head of Talent Acquisition, SVP, to fill a specific position.
description_json: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>Old National Bank was established in 1834. Today, we are the largest financial services holding company with dual headquarters in Chicago and Evansville, IN. We provide an array of services to our clients which include Commercial and Community Banking, Investments, and Wealth Management. At Old National, we believe that by helping our team members balance work life with home life, we create a more productive workforce and a stronger company.<br><br>We are looking for an experienced and versatile technical business analyst to improve our information technology systems. This Technical Business Analyst will be a member of the Wealth Management IT team mapping business requirements to appropriate technical solutions across Old National Bank Wealth Management business line functions, as well as deliver solutions to meet an array of internal and customer facing systems. This individual will be responsible for documenting existing business needs and developing new and enhanced business processes to ensure IT solutions support and align with business initiatives. Offices based in either Chicago near Rosemont, Minneapolis/St Paul area or Evansville Indiana.<br><br><strong><u>Key Accountabilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Act as IT project lead to ensure all business requirements are captured for design, testing and implementation of a variety of solutions across corporate systems needs and capabilities. </li><li> Continually seek opportunities to increase client satisfaction, deepen relationships, and effectively manage client expectations. </li><li> Work with business sponsors to determine business requirements necessary to increase efficiency and functionality of software/applications. </li><li> Design current and future state processes and assist with connecting all necessary teams together to push project from start to finish title: Software Engineer
description: At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.<p><br></p>There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.<p><br></p><strong>Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. </li><li>You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. </li><li>You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.</li><li>You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.</li><li>You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.</li><li>You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. </li></ul><p><br></p>Coinbase is seeking experienced backend engineers to join our team to build out the next generation of crypto-forward products and features. You will solve unique, large scale, highly complex technical problems, bridging the constraints posed by web-scale applications and blockchain technology. You will help build the next generation of systems to make cryptocurrency accessible to everyone across the globe, operating real-time applications with high frequency, low latency updates, and managing the most secure, dockerized infrastructure running in the cloud.<p><br></p>The Institutional Product Group engineers create and maintain a suite of products catering to institutional customers of all sizes from Hedge Funds (Coinbase Prime) to experienced individual traders (Coinbase Advanced Trade) and everything in between. Additional Products include Prime - Custody Only, Commerce and Exchange. Whether the customer needs are trading, staking, governance, custody or API integrations, Coinbase Institutional has them covered.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Decompose our monolithic Rails app into microservices</li><li>Articulate a long term vision for maintaining and scaling our backend systems.</li><li>Work with engineers, designers, product managers and senior leadership to turn our product and technical vision into a tangible roadmap every quarter.</li><li>Write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Look For In You</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You have at least 2+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li>You’ve designed, built, scaled and maintained production services, and know how to compose a service oriented architecture.</li><li>You write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers.</li><li>You’re passionate about building an open financial system that brings the world together.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You have gone through a rapid growth in your company (from startup to mid-size).</li><li>You’ve build growth experiments or A/B tests.</li><li>You have experience with Blockchains (such as Bitcoin, Ethereum etc..)</li><li>You have experience decomposing a large monolith into microservices.</li><li>You’ve worked with Golang, Ruby, Docker, Sinatra, Rails, Postgres, MongoDB or Redshift.</li><li>You’ve built financial, high reliability or security systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>Job #: GBE04NA<p><br></p><strong>Pay Transparency Notice:</strong> Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below. Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Range</u></strong><p><br></p>$140,250—$165,000 USD<p><br></p>Commitment to Equal Opportunity<p><br></p>Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Know Your Rights notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.<p><br></p>Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations[at]coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here).<p><br></p>Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants<p><br></p>Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required. For US applicants only, by submitting your application you are agreeing to arbitration of disputes as outlined here.

Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Range</u></strong><p><br></p>$140,250—$165,000 USD<p><br></p>Commitment to Equal Opportunity<p><br></p>Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
