title: Engineer, Test Engineer II
description: At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.<p><br></p>There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.<p><br></p><strong>Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. </li><li>You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. </li><li>You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.</li><li>You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.</li><li>You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.</li><li>You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. </li></ul><p><br></p>Coinbase is seeking experienced frontend engineers to join our team to build out the next generation of crypto-forward products and features. You will help build the next generation of systems to make cryptocurrency accessible to everyone across the globe.<p><br></p>The Consumer Product Group engineers strive to make the Coinbase retail app the easiest-to-use and fastest experience for accessing the crypto. In 2023, our goal is to be the #1 self custody wallet measured by MTU’s and download share. Wallet is the future of web3 and of Coinbase. Suite of products include: Coinbase app, advance trade, dapps, and staking.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and implement highly reliable interfaces to integrate with blockchains and NFTs, making it easy for users to buy, sell &amp; trade NFTs.</li><li>Build a mass market interface for digital non-fungible token apps by adding new functionality to existing cryptocurrencies (i.e. minting, NFT drops, campaigns).</li><li>Write infrastructural services that provide secure storage, accounting and transactional services to help our customers transfer assets safely.</li><li>Work with engineers, product managers and senior leadership to turn our vision into a tangible roadmap every quarter.</li><li>Add positive energy in every meeting, and make your coworkers feel included in every interaction.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Look For In You</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You have at least 2+ years of experience in developing web apps and shipping user-facing features with JavaScript and modern, component-based JS frameworks like React.</li><li>You have experience working on decentralized applications (Dapps).</li><li>You’ve developed and shipped user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks.</li><li>You’re familiar with current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, security and usability.</li><li>You’re familiar with product and design lifecycles, and collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and product managers.</li><li>You write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ve worked on front-end teams in the finance or security space</li><li>Experience with GraphQL and React Relay for data fetching &amp; rendering.</li><li>You have at least 1 year of experience in developing React apps or React Native apps</li></ul><p><br></p>Job #: GFE04NA<p><br></p>Pay Transparency Notice: Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range from $140,250 to $165,000 + target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).<p><br></p>Commitment to Equal Opportunity<p><br></p>Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Know Your Rights notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.<p><br></p>Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations[at]coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here).<p><br></p>Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants<p><br></p>Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required. For US applicants only, by submitting your application you are agreeing to arbitration of disputes as outlined here.

serve as the focal point for infrastructure-related issue / crisis resolution</li><li>See opportunities to save costs and more effectively handle assets</li><li>Ensure communication of process and procedure changes to key stakeholders</li><li>Design an effective test plan for any new / changed infrastructure technology and work with Project Managers, QA / Testing</li><li>Managers and Release Managers to ensure its implementation before the client takes possession of the system</li><li>Support identification and collection of metrics and performance reporting processes</li><li>Monitors delivery against SLAs and reports exceptions to management</li><li>Participate in process improvement initiatives, when applicable</li><li>Business Partnership</li><li>Maintain contact with the business users to proactively identify needed changes</li><li>Establish working relationships with technical, business and sourcing counterparts</li><li>Participate in process improvement initiatives</li><li>People Management</li><li>Handle individual workload and deliver to agreed upon milestones</li><li>Proactively promote consistent project-based performance measurement and skill development of junior staff</li><li>Actively participate in HR performance measurement processes</li><li>Demonstrate ability to work in team environment and help resolve issues</li><li>Provide input to staffing plans at the project-level to identify key / required skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>College degree in related technical / business areas or equivalent work experience</li><li>Understanding of the technology organization and / or business and technology</li><li>Re-engineering / process improvement experience, leading and coaching quality improvement projects</li><li>Strong change management skills; change agent</li><li>Excellent problem solving / analytical skills and knowledge of analytical tools</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to create / define metrics that accurately reflects the current state of a given process</li><li>Knowledge of Six Sigma, CMM and other relevant methodologies<br><br></li></ul>EEO Employer<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at [email protected] or 844-463-6178.<br><br>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico.<br><br>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. title: Engineer, Test Engineer II
description: JUNIOR JAVA DEVELOPER - USA at Wiley Edge (View all jobs) USA LOCATIONS: United States - we are looking for candidates who are flexible to working onsite in multiple locations across the United States. SALARY: $48,000 - $63,000 USD WANT TO START YOUR CAREER AS A JAVA DEVELOPER? Paid graduate training, ongoing support, opportunities at leading global employers - the Alumni graduate program gives you everything you need. (And don't worry, there's no training bond. No exit fees, no hidden catches). Here at Wiley Edge, we pair great graduates with brilliant global businesses. Our clients include tier one investment banks and other organizations across a range of industries, from insurance to healthcare to travel. WHAT YOU'LL DO: As a software developer with Wiley Edge, you'll build complex applications in a global team environment. You'll love seeing the impact you make when code you've written launches to the people who need it. If you stay on the lookout for new ways to get better results through software development, you'll become an asset to your team. HOW THE ALUMNI PROGRAM WORKS: Apply via this job advert. Complete our assessment process. Get trained at Wiley Edge Academy in an online class for 4-8 weeks with other graduates. Focusing on Golang, or other languages depending on which coding languages our clients are looking for at the time. Join a Wiley Edge client for 12-24 months while receiving support and salary increases every 6 months. The vast majority then convert to permanent employees with the client at the end of the program. WHAT YOU'LL LEARN AT THE WILEY EDGE ACADEMY: How to design, develop, and test a full-stack application. How to demonstrate professionalism, including communication skills and personal interactions. How to explain industry concepts at a high level. An understanding of monitoring, supporting, and troubleshooting, and how it ties into good development processes. WHAT YOU'LL NEED: Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related major A GPA of 3.0 or higher. We look for potential, not prestige, but it's important that you enjoy pushing yourself to pick up new ideas. Experience with OOP (object-oriented programming). Solid knowledge of software engineering principles (data structures, OOP, design patterns, multithreading). Skills in troubleshooting and debugging. Knowledge of database concepts (SQL, stored procs, schema design). An understanding of the formal SDLC (software development lifecycle). An understanding of test-driven development. The right to work without needing visa sponsorship. A requirement for this role may be to attest and provide proof of vaccination for Covid 19 upon hire. WHAT YOU'LL GET: Our classes our in-depth and interactive and are composed of small classes with other graduates like you. Our training is created and delivered by industry experts who know your field inside and out. A generous graduate salary. Pay rises every 6 months to reflect your progress. Financial assistance for candidates relocating for a role. (The amount of financial assistance depends on the distance you are relocating.) Fully paid, in-depth, interactive training in small classes with graduates like you. Our training is created and delivered by industry experts who know your field inside out. A generous graduate salary. Pay rises every 6 months to reflect your progress. A flexible benefits package including gym membership. Ongoing training and support. Valuable industry experience. Ultimately, a foot in the door to build your career in an in-demand niche. HOW TO APPLY: Apply via the form below and tell us a bit about you. Complete the online assessment (we'll send you a link by email). Complete the interviews with our friendly talent team over phone and video. Lastly, you'll interview with one or more of our clients. So you don’t miss out on your dream job, we encourage you to be open to relocating. We take great pride in celebrating the diversity of each and every individual who contributes to making Wiley Edge the company it is today and will be in the future. We value diversity both within Wiley Edge and with our partner companies, and we're proud to provide an environment where all our colleagues can flourish. That means promoting a strong culture of equality but, most importantly, inclusion. We never want people to change - only add to the amazing mix of people that work for Wiley Edge. We are committed to fair, transparent pay, and we strive to provide competitive compensation in addition to a comprehensive benefits package. The base pay rate for this position is $48,000- $63,000 USD. This pay rate represents Wiley Edge’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the base pay for this role at the time of posting and based on the locations listed in the job advertisement. It is anticipated that qualified candidates selected for a placement will receive this pay rate as a starting salary once onsite with the Wiley Edge client, however, the ultimate salary offered for this role may be higher or lower and will be set based on a variety of non-discriminatory factors, including but not limited to, geographic location, skills, and competencies. The stated salary and benefits package will be received once the training in the Wiley Edge Academy has been successfully completed and the candidate starts on-site with the Wiley Edge client. Trainees are paid a stipend of $625 USD for a full week of training in the Academy; training durations vary depending on training pathways and will be disclosed during the recruitment process.

title: Technical Business Analyst / Financial Systems
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $100 – $112/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are:<br></strong><ul><li>You have familiarity with some of the following: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP), creating dashboards in tools such as Looker or Tableau for monitoring and insights, building and monitoring cloud services, infrastructure as code technologies such as Terraform, AWS Cloud Formation, Ansible, etc, Big Data experience with tools such as Spark.</li><li>You understand that being an effective software engineer is about communicating with people as much as it is about writing code</li><li>You are generous with your time and experience, and can mentor and learn from other engineers</li><li>You can tackle unconstrained problems and know when to seek help</li><li>You are flexible with languages and tools and willing to learn whatever is necessary to complete the job.</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>What’s the role?<br><br></strong>Our client's Data Enablement organization's mission is to enable the use of data at scale and to unlock learning through experimentation. As part of the Data Governance &amp; Privacy team, you will join a highly visible team with a top priority of protecting sensitive information of our client's buyers and sellers. The team is responsible for building services and processes to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in their data warehouses. You'll be part of our client's journey to modernize how they protect personal data<br><br>They work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP). Languages include Java, Python, PHP and SQL, and they work with technologies like Terraform, Spark, Airflow, and BigQuery. Experience with any of these is helpful but not required; above all, they value curiosity, responsibility, and eagerness to solve complex engineering problems. They're looking for a flexible engineer, who can work with the internal customers, and embraces pivoting to the appropriate tool for the job rather than having deep expertise in single systems<br><br>The technical staff believes that code is craft, and that the work they do is part of a larger creative culture that includes the hundreds of thousands of inspired artists and designers who make the Company such a unique marketplace. They believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. They believe in measuring everything, taking advantage of their continuous deployment system to ship code early and often, and keeping up a blameless culture based on trust and a commitment to learning.<br><br>This is a position reporting to the Engineering Manager, Data Governance &amp; Privacy. For this role, they are considering candidates who are either remote, flex, or office-based. The team is geographically dispersed, but works in North America Time Zones<br><br><strong>What does the day-to-day look like?<br></strong><ul><li>You will build and maintain internal tools for tracking and inventorying GCS file sets using Google Storage Insight</li><li>You will work with your team to develop methods to programmatically apply column tags and Policy Tags on BigQuery data sets to identify and protect Personally Identifiable Information</li><li>You will help measure the team’s progress in our work by creating dashboards and monitoring in tools such as Looker or Tableau<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6589<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Software Engineer, Backend - Institutional
description: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><strong> RECRUITING FOR THE FUTURE <br><br></strong>This posting is for a future job opportunity.<br><br>To support the needs of our clients, Avanade is actively recruiting and interviewing for the role outlined below, as we continue to build on another year of growth in our business. Now, with more than 60,000 employees around the globe, we are positioning our organization to effectively prepare for the future. What does this mean for you? We encourage you to apply and interview for this role without the need to decide now. This allows you to connect with leaders and hiring managers at a pace that works for you and when roles become available, you will be the first know.<br><br>Do you make complex technology look easy? So do we.<br><br>You know Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solutions do more than keep businesses running; they race them forward. We’ll surround you with people who as are passionate about technology and innovation as you are.<br><br><strong>About You<br><br></strong>You r in-depth understanding of how enterprise works enable you to create seamless solutions that build businesses. You’re a dedicated, analytical software developer who turns issues into improvements. You love put ting your skills to the test, offering new ideas for exciting transformation projects, and you enjoy guiding the full li fecycle of software development from analyzing requirements to delivering real solutions for clients.<br><br><strong>About The Job<br><br></strong>Enterprise Resource P lanning is all about helping businesses simplify complexity and thrive in the digital age. You’ll be solving your clients’ challenges and turning their needs into goals and solutions with Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&amp;O). Y ou’ll design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems. You’ll get to work on systems and applications for market sale, as well as large-scale proprietary software for our own use.<br><br>As an ERP Software Developer , you’ll:<br><br><ul><li> Use Dynamics F&amp;O to design, develop, document, test, and debug new modules and extensions. </li><li> Write technical specifications based on conceptual designs and business requirements. </li><li> Identify and evaluate new technologies for implementation. </li><li> Support colleagues in tracing during prototyping <br><br></li></ul>Your skills<br><br>You’re a flexible manager who can switch between projects and processes and reshape work plans – all the while maintaining focus and supporting your team. You love an informal environment where you can use your initiative and judgment to direct your own work and that of your team . You understand how businesses work inside and out , and pair your proven technical capabilities with your great interpersonal skills to offer both technical and operational support and mentorship .<br><br><strong> Your experience includes: <br><br></strong><ul><li> Working with Microsoft Dynamics AX or F&amp;O </li><li> 4+ years of X++ Development </li><li> A solid grasp of organi z ational policies and process </li><li> A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field </li><li> Six to eight years of professional experience </li><li> Mentor ing and s upporting junior colleagues , and supervising project teams . <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Avanade<br><br></strong>Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.<br><br>We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.<br><br>We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.<br><br>Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

(Houston or Chicago) Must be local to either city.<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Job Summary:Program and build software using languages and technologies of the .NET framework. You will create applications from scratch, configure existing systems and provide user support.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Participate in requirements analysis Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture Write clean, scalable code using .NET programming languages Test and deploy applications and systems Revise, update, refactor and debug code Improve existing software Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC) Serve as an expert on applications and provide technical support Qualifications: Proven experience as a .NET Developer Familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, SQL Server and design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC)) Knowledge of at least one of the .NET languages (e.g. C#, Visual Basic .NET) and HTML5/CSS3 Familiarity with architecture styles/APIs (REST, RPC) Understanding of Agile methodologies. title: Software Engineer, Frontend - Consumer
description: <ul><li>LOOKING FOR A NEW LABVIEW OPPORTUNITY?</li><li>I have the one for YOU! My client manufactures Electronics and Telematics for the Automotive/Transportation industry. They are looking for a Tenured Test Engineer to help test the Electronics during and post manufacturing. You will be apart of the team that develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit that is built to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws, focusing on manufacturing defects. You will be building a collection of instruments that takes measurements on the products. You will be working with the product designs in that phase to come up with the test requirements and then write the software to implement. You will control the software that you design and write the software to control instrumentation and the unit that we are testing.</li><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* *</li><li>Labview - Top Skill*</li><li>C# - Or other Object oriented languages within test and instrumentation</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL or MySQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design</li><li>Test procedure</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Debug</li><li>Test Fixture</li><li>Production</li><li>Manufacturing</li><li>Lab</li><li>Validation</li><li>Test plan</li><li>Test engineering</li><li>Electrical</li><li>Test equipment</li><li>Write test scripts</li><li>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, WiFi)</li><li>Automotive is a plus but not required</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Job Title: Supply Chain Specialist </strong><p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Rogers Park 60626<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Long Term Contract<p><br></p>As a contract employee of Sterling, you are eligible to receive a <strong>Full Em</strong><strong>ployee Benefits Package </strong>that includes <strong>paid time off, paid holidays, 3 medical plans to choose from, dental &amp; vision plans, 401(k), and an Employee Stock Ownership (ESOP) plan.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a <strong>Supply</strong><strong> Chain Specialist</strong>. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the Sourcing Managers and Sourcing Analyst in various tasks related to supplier information analysis and database management. Your primary focus will be on gathering and analyzing data, coordinating with suppliers, and assisting in sourcing activities.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Assist the Sourcing Managers and Sourcing Analyst with information analysis as needed.</li><li>Create and analyze a supplier information database, including pricing, annual usage, material details, part weight, secondary operations, etc. Gather data from multiple sources and coordinate with suppliers.</li><li>Prepare quote packages, conduct quote analysis (including cost breakdown detail), and assist with supplier research.</li><li>Assemble requests for information and support in the collection and analysis of raw material market information.</li><li>Update supplier information in Oracle or a similar ERP system, such as pricing, lead times, part descriptions, and drawing revision levels.</li><li>Handle documentation and provide training as required by the Global sourcing team.</li><li>Work on special projects as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated analytical skills, preferably in a manufacturing sourcing environment.</li><li>Advanced intermediate or better competence in using Excel, Word, and other MS Office software.</li><li>Experience navigating, updating, and extracting data from an Oracle or similar ERP system.</li><li>Strong cross-functional collaboration abilities with excellent communication skills.</li><li>Bachelor’s degree preferred, preferably in finance, accounting, or business.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</em></strong>

title: DevOps Engineer
description: <strong><u>Remote Work Is Not Available In The Following States</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Alabama, Alaska, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Hawaii, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Maine, Maryland, Mississippi, Montana, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Mexico, New York, Oregon, Tennessee, Texas, Washington, West Virginia, Wyoming.</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Who We Are</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Fidelity Life</strong> is a leading provider of financial security for middle-market consumers. With a history of innovation, the company is redefining the life insurance industry with patented products and processes. Fidelity Life pioneered the use of predictive analytics to streamline the new business process and revolutionize the speed with which policies can be issued. Established in 1896, Fidelity Life enjoys a long track record of success and continues to build its reputation of sound fiscal management and customer-focused innovation.<p><br></p>In concert with Fidelity Life, <strong>eFinancial</strong> is an online and call-center-based insurance agency with a proven direct-to-consumer life insurance model. Using a proprietary and patented sales technology platform, eFinancial operates call centers in Chicago, IL; Seattle, WA; and Tempe, AZ. eFinancial’ s licensed agents and representatives reach thousands of consumers each day to help meet their unique life insurance needs – often with just a single phone call. The company has expanded to offer digital purchase experiences across brands and products to complement this channel.<p><br></p>Together, Fidelity Life and eFinancial are revolutionizing the life insurance industry to make life insurance more accessible and affordable for everyday Americans. With an integrated marketing, product manufacturing, and controlled distribution system, the enterprise is uniquely positioned for growth.<p><br></p><strong><u>What The Job Looks Like</u></strong><p><br></p>The Digital Marketing Analyst will provide reporting, analytics, and insights to enhance our digital marketing performance while identifying opportunities for continued growth. This role is instrumental to increasing customer acquisition, cross-sell effectiveness, retention, and loyalty.<p><br></p>The Digital Marketing Analyst role reports to the Senior Director of Marketing Analytics and will perform analyses across the digital ecosystem including lead generation and funnel conversion optimization, digital purchase experience, campaign performance, lead nurturing, and ongoing experimentation across various web properties, landing pages, and campaigns.<p><br></p>The ideal Digital Marketing Analyst candidate must be highly analytical and possess the skills to translate data into insights and visualizations that convey a narrative easily understood by various audiences. This person will be responsible for daily/weekly/monthly KPI monitoring and reporting and presenting actionable insights. A demonstrated understanding of digital tracking/tagging and experience using a tag management system (Google Tag Manager, Tealium, etc.) and working with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics is required. Ideal candidates will have prior experience in business(es) with a direct-to-consumer lead generation funnel or e-commerce purchase journey, with additional benefit if the operations include an inside sales call center.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide data analysis and insights to help accelerate the sales growth and profitability of the digital purchase experience across proprietary and partner sites. Track and analyze the digital purchase funnel key performance indicators (KPIs) such as page conversion rates, cart abandonment conversion, and traffic by partnership source</li><li>Manage test design and experimentation for multiple web properties</li><li>Utilize data analytics tools to query, filter, and merge large data sets, analyze results and make actionable recommendations</li><li>Prepare and present reports to key stakeholders that provide critical business updates, identify opportunities, and mitigate risks</li><li>Provide maintenance, updates, and ongoing audits of GTM tagging across properties (eFinancial/Fidelity Life/eCoverage/Digital/ Partners)</li><li>Troubleshoot Google Analytics tracking issues including page tags, conversion tracking, custom events, and ecommerce tracking</li><li>Update and maintain web site dashboards and assist in preparing regular KPI dashboards for digital channels including ecommerce and partnership websites</li><li>Proactively surface opportunities for reporting automation, and shine light on data anomalies that may indicate data discrepancies or opportunities to uncover new insights</li><li>Continually contemplate and suggest new ways to enhance tried and true reporting</li><li>Seek opportunities to tie down funnel profitability and performance data (e.g. conversion, placement, retention, product mix) to upper funnel KPIs (CPL, CPA, CTR, LCR, etc.)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Should Bring To The Table</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative field required; background in business, marketing, mathematics, statistics, economics a plus</li><li>5+ years of experience in web/digital marketing analytics and reporting required, ideally Google Partner certified</li><li>3+ years’ experience using a tag management system (Google Tag Manager, Adobe DTM, Tealium, etc.)</li><li>Proven experience with analysis, reporting, and providing actionable insights</li><li>Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel to create complex reporting models from concept to completion (e.g., pivot tables, charts, vlookup, sumifs, etc.)</li><li>Experience with a large portion of the following tools and applications:</li><li> Web analytics (Google 360, Google Tag Manager, etc.)</li><li> Data visualization (PowerBI, Tableau, Google Data Studio)</li><li> SEM (semrush, moz, AdWords, etc.)</li><li> Web visualization (VWO)</li><li> SQL, BigQuery</li><li> A/B testing and personalization (VWO, Google Optimize)</li><li>Experience preparing dashboards and understanding of key digital marketing metrics (e.g., CPA, CPL, CTR, CPC, CPM, etc.)</li><li>Understanding of current digital marketing best practices and trends</li><li>Familiarity with UTM codes and their appropriate use for campaign tracking</li><li>Excellent project and time management skills, with ability to support a range of marketing analytic dashboards and projects across brands and digital channels</li><li>Driven, self-motivated attitude. Ability to do great work independently with minimal direction as well as collaborate closely with teams.</li><li>Willingness to go beyond the traditional data queries and to understand online behavior from a user and site experience perspective</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>EEOC/Other</u></strong><p><br></p><em>Efinancial LLC, Fidelity Life Association, its parents subsidiaries and affiliates (collectively “The Company”) are equal employment opportunity employers. We adhere to a policy of making employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, marital status, age, disability or any status protected by law. We assure you that your opportunity for employment with this Company depends solely on your qualifications.</em><p><br></p>#IND-Corporate #IND #FidelityLifeAssociation #Remote #Hiring<p><br></p>

Track and analyze the digital purchase funnel key performance indicators (KPIs) such as page conversion rates, cart abandonment conversion, and traffic by partnership source</li><li>Manage test design and experimentation for multiple web properties</li><li>Utilize data analytics tools to query, filter, and merge large data sets, analyze results and make actionable recommendations</li><li>Prepare and present reports to key stakeholders that provide critical business updates, identify opportunities, and mitigate risks</li><li>Provide maintenance, updates, and ongoing audits of GTM tagging across properties (eFinancial/Fidelity Life/eCoverage/Digital/ Partners)</li><li>Troubleshoot Google Analytics tracking issues including page tags, conversion tracking, custom events, and ecommerce tracking</li><li>Update and maintain web site dashboards and assist in preparing regular KPI dashboards for digital channels including ecommerce and partnership websites</li><li>Proactively surface opportunities for reporting automation, and shine light on data anomalies that may indicate data discrepancies or opportunities to uncover new insights</li><li>Continually contemplate and suggest new ways to enhance tried and true reporting</li><li>Seek opportunities to tie down funnel profitability and performance data (e.g. conversion, placement, retention, product mix) to upper funnel KPIs (CPL, CPA, CTR, LCR, etc.)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Should Bring To The Table</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative field required; background in business, marketing, mathematics, statistics, economics a plus</li><li>5+ years of experience in web/digital marketing analytics and reporting required, ideally Google Partner certified</li><li>3+ years’ experience using a tag management system (Google Tag Manager, Adobe DTM, Tealium, etc.)</li><li>Proven experience with analysis, reporting, and providing actionable insights</li><li>Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel to create complex reporting models from concept to completion (e.g., pivot tables, charts, vlookup, sumifs, etc.)</li><li>Experience with a large portion of the following tools and applications:</li><li> Web analytics (Google 360, Google Tag Manager, etc.)</li><li> Data visualization (PowerBI, Tableau, Google Data Studio)</li><li> SEM (semrush, moz, AdWords, etc.)</li><li> Web visualization (VWO)</li><li> SQL, BigQuery</li><li> A/B testing and personalization (VWO, Google Optimize)</li><li>Experience preparing dashboards and understanding of key digital marketing metrics (e.g., CPA, CPL, CTR, CPC, CPM, etc.)</li><li>Understanding of current digital marketing best practices and trends</li><li>Familiarity with UTM codes and their appropriate use for campaign tracking</li><li>Excellent project and time management skills, with ability to support a range of marketing analytic dashboards and projects across brands and digital channels</li><li>Driven, self-motivated attitude. Ability to do great work independently with minimal direction as well as collaborate closely with teams.</li><li>Willingness to go beyond the traditional data queries and to understand online behavior from a user and site experience perspective</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>EEOC/Other</u></strong><p><br></p><em>Efinancial LLC, Fidelity Life Association, its parents subsidiaries and affiliates (collectively “The Company”) are equal employment opportunity employers. We adhere to a policy of making employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, marital status, age, disability or any status protected by law. We assure you that your opportunity for employment with this Company depends solely on your qualifications.</em><p><br></p>#IND-Corporate #IND #FidelityLifeAssociation #Remote #Hiring<p><br></p>

title: Junior Java Developer – USA
description: At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.<p><br></p>There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.<p><br></p><strong>Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. </li><li>You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. </li><li>You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.</li><li>You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.</li><li>You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.</li><li>You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. </li></ul><p><br></p>Coinbase is seeking experienced backend engineers to join our team to build out the next generation of crypto-forward products and features. You will solve unique, large scale, highly complex technical problems, bridging the constraints posed by web-scale applications and blockchain technology. You will help build the next generation of systems to make cryptocurrency accessible to everyone across the globe, operating real-time applications with high frequency, low latency updates, and managing the most secure, dockerized infrastructure running in the cloud.<p><br></p>The mission of the Developer Product Group engineers are to create solutions so builders can build in crypto. Their suite of products include: Base, WaaS, and Cloud. Our most recent offering, Coinbase Base, is an Ethereum L2 built to scale the crypto economy, the foundation for continuing the on-chain journey. Wallet-as-a-Service (WaaS) is an API-based crypto platform that will enable developers to interact with heterogeneous cryptocurrency networks (such as Bitcoin, Ethereum and Cardano) in a simple, secure and scalable way. Coinbase Cloud provides web3 APIs, services, and infrastructure to power the next generation of software builders.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Decompose our monolithic Rails app into microservices</li><li>Articulate a long term vision for maintaining and scaling our backend systems.</li><li>Work with engineers, designers, product managers and senior leadership to turn our product and technical vision into a tangible roadmap every quarter.</li><li>Write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Look For In You</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You have at least 2+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li>You’ve designed, built, scaled and maintained production services, and know how to compose a service oriented architecture.</li><li>You write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers.</li><li>You’re passionate about building an open financial system that brings the world together.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You have gone through a rapid growth in your company (from startup to mid-size).</li><li>You’ve build growth experiments or A/B tests.</li><li>You have experience with Blockchains (such as Bitcoin, Ethereum etc..)</li><li>You have experience decomposing a large monolith into microservices.</li><li>You’ve worked with Golang, Ruby, Docker, Sinatra, Rails, Postgres, MongoDB or Redshift.</li><li>You’ve built financial, high reliability or security systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>Job #: GBE04NA<p><br></p><strong>Pay Transparency Notice:</strong> Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below. Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Range</u></strong><p><br></p>$140,250—$165,000 USD<p><br></p>Commitment to Equal Opportunity<p><br></p>Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Know Your Rights notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.<p><br></p>Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations[at]coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here).<p><br></p>Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants<p><br></p>Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required. For US applicants only, by submitting your application you are agreeing to arbitration of disputes as outlined here.

title: Future Opportunity - D365 ERP Developer
description: <strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. </li><li>Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications</li><li>Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. </li><li>Participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. </li><li>Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. </li><li>Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. </li><li>Builds productive internal/external working relationships. </li><li>Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Usually works with some supervision, conferring with superiors on unusual or complex matters</li><li>Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. </li><li>Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization</li><li>Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. </li><li>Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities. </li><li>Acts as individual contributor as well as team member</li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. </li><li>Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. </li><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. </li></ul><strong>About Walgreens and WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree and at least 2 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience OR High School/ GED and at least 4 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience</li><li>Experience writing code for applications or automation</li><li>Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices, APIs or mobile applications</li><li>Experience building, testing applications or automation</li><li>Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle</li><li>Experience creating coding solutions to fix moderate problems/issues</li><li>Willing to travel up to 5% of the time for business purposes (domestically and/or internationally). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong> <ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar field</li><li> Experience working in an Agile environment</li><ul><li>At least 2 years of progressively complex related experience. </li></ul><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems</li><li>DevOps</li><li>2+ years of on experience is Deployment automation for various applications IaaS, PaaS platforms</li><li>2+ years of hands-on experience in automation software like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform or equivalent</li><li>Good knowledge of GIT workflows and Repo management</li><li>Excellent knowledge in implement of CI/CD pipelines for Cloud deployments using containers/Docker</li><li>Working knowledge of Kubernetes and microservices architecture and other DevOps tooling and Linux environments</li><li>Working knowledge or experience of software development for Web and Mobile applications in agile environments</li><li>Web/backend Developer</li><li>Previous experience with full stack development ranging from front-end user interfaces to back-end systems</li><li>Proficient in back-end languages like Java, Node/Typescript, .NET, Python etc. with exposure to performance optimization of high traffic &amp; scalable services</li><li>Hands on with modern UI frameworks like React with good knowledge of front-end design pattern (stateless components, conditional rendering, controlled components, hooks etc.)</li><li>Excellent knowledge of distributed SQL (e.g., Oracle, MySQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra) design &amp; consumption patterns</li><li>Have an exposure to implementation, capacity planning &amp; performance tuning of Cloud technologies – Azure (ACS, AKS), Google, IBM, AWS or Cloud Foundry</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations</li><li>Mobile Developer</li><li>2 years of Mobile App development experience and hands on skills in Swift, SwiftUI, Objective C ( iOS)</li><li>2 Years of Mobile App development experience and hands-on skills in Kotlin ( Android)</li><li>Experience in building client applications consuming JSON based on APIs</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations</li><li>Software Engineer in Test</li><li>3+ years of experience as an SDET, Developer, or strong Automation Engineer</li><li>Experience developing automation in at least one OO language - Java, C#/C++, Python or web based technologies</li><li>Proven experience creating automation frameworks and tools to support test automation</li><li>Experience working in a Microservices based architecture in a cloud native environment</li><li>Data &amp; Analytics</li><li>2 years of experience in integrating, transforming and consolidating data from various structured and unstructured data systems for building analytics solutions in any cloud Platforms: Microsoft Azure, AWS or GCP</li><li>Experience with relational and NoSQL databases such as Cosmos, Cassandra</li><li>2 years of Experience in SQL, Java or Python programming</li><li>Experience in Data Pipeline and integration workflow management tools: Talend, Store Proc, Change Data Capture (CDC), Spark &amp; Azure API</li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending fixes to resolve problems</li><li>Knowledge in Azure cloud technologies like Data Flow, Data Bricks, Azure Synapse, Power BI Analytics</li><li>Experience in any of reporting tools like Power BI, Business objects, Cognos or Tableau</li></ul>

programming</li><li>Experience in Data Pipeline and integration workflow management tools: Talend, Store Proc, Change Data Capture (CDC), Spark &amp; Azure API</li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending fixes to resolve problems</li><li>Knowledge in Azure cloud technologies like Data Flow, Data Bricks, Azure Synapse, Power BI Analytics</li><li>Experience in any of reporting tools like Power BI, Business objects, Cognos or Tableau</li></ul>

title: Engineer, Test Engineer II
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong>We are an agile, passionate team capable of building scalable, performant solutions to solve real world problems on a global scale. As a member of the Accounting IT team, you will work with our account teams and IT teams to write and update Accounting applications using modern technologies. The successful candidate will need to work in a team environment, help influence the direction of our technology and be able to interact with other team members and teams on creating exciting solutions to complex problems. You will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact – the work you do will help in tangible ways.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Follow our software development practices and methodologies</li><li>Participate in scrum ceremonies, including Story Pointing, Sprint Planning, Sprint Reviews and Sprint Retrospectives</li><li>Create/enhance applications that will enable Accounting to work in smarter, faster and more efficient ways.</li><li>Translate requirements and develop software architectures and designs to bring them to life.</li><li>Communicate effectively in a collaborative, complex and high performing team environment.</li><li>Willingness to participate in all aspects of the software development life cycle.</li><li>Follow team and company software development guidelines.</li><li> The list of responsibilities may not be all-inclusive and can be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities as needed.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.</li><li>5-8 years of experience developing software in professional environment, preferably in C#, .Net</li><li>5 years of professional relational database development (Microsoft SQL Server)</li><li>5 years of professional basic web technologies (HTML, XML)</li><li>Strong in Computer Science fundamentals and core areas like problem solving, data structures, algorithms and complexity analysis.</li><li>Strong understanding of Enterprise architecture patterns, Object Oriented &amp; Service Oriented principles, design patterns, industry best practices</li><li>Ability to test your work thoroughly before moving onto the next task.</li><li>Strong customer orientation, communication and attention to detail.</li><li>Good sense of user interaction and usability design to provide an intuitive, seamless end user experience.</li><li>Excellent communications skills and the ability to work with subject matter expert to extract critical business concepts.</li><li>Experience working both independently and in a team oriented, collaborative environment is essential.</li><li>Ability to mentor and offer constructive feedback to junior team members.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects and work effectively under time constraints as necessary.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Desired Skills:<br></strong><ul><li>Knowledge of Accounting/Financial processes/data or a strong desire to learn</li><li>Interest and ability to learn new technologies as required.</li><li>Analyze and recommend development strategies, process improvements and standards.</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following technologies: Front-end development frameworks, Cloud services (Microsoft Azure), Kubernetes, Message queue-based designs/implementations, Git code repositories</li><li>Knowledge of server-side configuration and deployment (IIS, TeamCity, Octopus, Azure DevOps).</li><li>ETL and Data Management / Data Integration</li><li>Web Services (SOAP) and REST API connection / testing</li></ul>

title: .NET Developer III

Candidates should be in USA.<br><br><strong>Duration:</strong> Full Time only - "Cognizant will only consider applicants for this position who are legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship (H-1B, L-1B, L-1A, etc.).”<br><br><strong>Salary and Other Compensation: <br><br></strong>The annual salary for this position is between <strong>$[125,000.00-$135,000.00]</strong> depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.<br><br>This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans.<br><br><strong>Benefits:</strong> Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:<br><ul><li>Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance</li><li>Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) plan and contributions</li><li>Long-term/Short-term Disability</li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan<br><br></li></ul><strong>Disclaimer:</strong> The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.<br><br><strong>Job Description and Qualifications include:</strong> (This is a hands-on development role)<br><br><strong>Required: <br></strong><ul><li> 8+ years of experience in Adobe Campaign Classic.</li><li> Hands-on experience in Adobe Campaign Classic configurations and end-to-end setup.</li><li> Hands-on experience in setup of offer management and real-time communications using message center.</li><li> Hands-on experience in setup of web applications, surveys, external account configurations.</li><li> Hands-on experience in setup of recipient &amp; customer data schemes, technical &amp; campaign workflows.</li><li> Hands-on experience in Java Script, Soap &amp; Rest API services to interact with any upstream/downstream systems.</li><li> Hands-on experience in development of marketing campaigns/workflows.</li><li> Hands-on experience in development of technical workflows and reporting.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Nice To Have Bonus Skills<br></strong><ul><li> One or more certifications in Adobe Campaign Classic</li><li> Experience in integration of Adobe Campaign with Adobe Analytics, Audience Manager, Adobe Target</li><li> Any additional certifications in Adobe Marketing Cloud solutions products<br><br></li></ul><strong>Education<br></strong><ul><li> BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience</li><li> Should be self-motivated, self-starter with clear communication skills who thrives working in a team environment<br><br></li></ul><strong>EEO Statement &amp; Accommodations<br><br></strong>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.<br><br><strong>About Cognizant<br><br></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. title: Test Engineer
description: <p>Looking for | Java Security Engineer @ Chicago, IL (MUST BE LOCAL) -- Hybrid Role (Only GC AND Citizens)</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Position: Java Security Engineer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL (MUST BE LOCAL)</strong></p><p><strong>Duration: 6 Months with EXT&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Only GC AND Citizens&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Job Description:</strong></p><ul><li>This position for onboarding an experienced Java Developer contractor dedicated to security initiatives.</li><li>Responsible for assisting implementing and supporting Cybersecurity and Digital Risk program initiatives as they are related to applications within portfolio</li><li>Resources will be responsible for protecting systems data technologies and our airline by implementing and embedding Cybersecurity in the full development lifecycle</li><li>Provide ongoing support and completion of daily tasks for cybersecurity programs such as incident response application cybersecurity vulnerability management and remediation cloud and infrastructure cybersecurity data protection and privacy and risk management and compliance.</li><li>Support and action cybersecurity threat assessments</li><li>Collaborate with digital technology business teams and external partners to build relationships supporting accountabilities and ensure consistency adaptability responsiveness and effectiveness of security solutions</li><li>Measure and communicate progress for overall Cybersecurity health of applications in scope</li><li>Communicate information with dependent teams and resources Skilled software engineer to design develop document debug and test secure software applications.</li><li>Review and implement security best practices and industry standards conducting security analysis review and resolve security vulnerabilities and mitigate risks.</li><li>Collaborate with other internal and external partners and entities to measure and evaluate cyber security threat assessments.</li><li>Provide support and mentorship to other members of the team.</li></ul><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Able to articulate plan Implement test and operate advanced software security techniques and best practices in compliance with technical reference architecture</li><li>Perform on-going security testing and code review to improve software security</li><li>Troubleshoot and debug issues that arise</li><li>Provide engineering designs for new software solutions to help mitigate security vulnerabilities</li><li>Contribute to all levels of the architecture from security aspects</li><li>Maintain technical documentation</li><li>Respond to security related incidents</li><li>Measure and communicate progress for overall Cybersecurity health of applications in scope</li><li>Support and mentor team members on secure coding practices</li></ul><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Requirements and skills:</strong></p><ul><li>Proven work experience as a software security engineer</li><li>Detailed technical knowledge of techniques standards and state-of-the art capabilities for security vulnerabilities and remediation</li><li>Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience with Java Spring Boot</li><li>Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience with foundational AWS Services such as EC2 S3 RDS VPC CloudTrail CloudFront Lambda EKS and/or ECS</li><li>In-depth knowledge of various web-related technologies such as Web applications services architectures etc.</li><li>Experience with analytic tools such as ELK Stack Google Analytics or AppD</li><li>Experience working with high performance teams in an agile development environment where continuous integration and continuous delivery CI/CD are critical</li><li>Have experience with secure software development life cycle framework</li><li>Experience with security principles</li><li>Demonstrate knowledge of software engineering best practices such as version control software packaging and software release management</li><li>Must be self-motivated possess strong communication skills verbal and written and be able to work in a team-oriented environment</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills attention to detail</li></ul><p><br></p>
