title: Supply Chain Specialist
description: Wintrust is a financial holding company with approximately $50 billion assets under management and traded on the NASDAQ:WTFC. Built on the "HAVE IT ALL" model, Wintrust offers sophisticated technology and resources of a large bank while focusing on providing service-based community banking to each and every customer. Wintrust operates fifteen community bank subsidiaries with over 170 banking locations in the greater Chicago and southern Wisconsin market areas. Additionally, Wintrust operates various non-bank business units including commercial and life insurance premium financing, short-term accounts receivable financing, out-sourced administrative services, mortgage origination and purchase, wealth management services and qualified intermediary services for tax-deferred exchanges.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>An award-winning culture! We are rated a Top Workplace by the Chicago Tribune (past 8 years) and Employee Recommended award by the Globe &amp; Mail (past 6 years)</li><li>Competitive pay and discretionary or incentive bonus eligible</li><li>Comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, vision, life, a 401k plan with a generous company match and tuition reimbursement to name a few</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Why join this team? </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We hold ourselves accountable to high standards, share wins, operate ethically, and have fun</li><li>Master Data Management (MDM) team members play a key part in the Wintrust Digital Journey supporting enterprise applications including CRM, Digital Banking, Account Opening Platform, LOS etc.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Advanced Middleware Developer is a key position within the Data Management team, responsible for the development, test and implementation of best coding practices in complex Integration solutions for the organization, including application connectivity, Performance, Security and audit. This role will be engaged in all phases of the API lifecycle, and follows all the best practices that were put in place. Successful candidate will have a proven track record demonstrating sound technical and business knowledge.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, development and continuous improvement of complex and critical data projects.</li><li>Design and develop data ingestion frameworks, leveraging open source tools and data processing frameworks.</li><li>Enhance data solutions that enables seamless integration and flow of data across the data ecosystem.</li><li>Participate in and support initiatives outside of main area of responsibility.</li><li>Support/enhance/create data solutions to ensure business continuity, ensuring all related processes meets best-in-class standards offering high performance.</li><li>Support and maintain existing integration solutions for Middleware systems for operational and analytical applications.</li><li>Required to work in other areas of Data Enablement lifecycle as needed.</li><li>Work on the API specification documentation.</li><li>Ensure DevOps practices are implemented for all data solutions.</li><li>Participate in all types of testing and triages.</li><li>Required to work in other areas of Data Enablement lifecycle, including batch and real time processes using SQL Server, SSIS ETL/ETL, MuleSoft as needed.</li><li>Onboard the new team members to the projects from both technical and business standpoint.</li><li>Analyze the requirements and prepare technical specifications and detail level design documents.</li><li>Conducts research and provide technology solutions.</li><li>Participates in code reviews.</li><li>Takes ownership of projects.</li><li>Supports and guides junior team members.</li><li>Serves as resource to internal and third-party team members on escalated issues and analyzing and designing specifications for less experienced team members</li><li>Pursues self-development and effective relationships with others by sharing resources, information, and knowledge with coworkers and customers.</li><li>Seeks opportunities to deliver continuous process improvement, automating manual processes and optimizing data delivery.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree with 3+ years’ experience or Master’s degree with 2+ years’ experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or other quantitative field.</li><li>2+ years’ experience in Application or API development - designing, implementing data persistence, data processing, data integration and MDM Solutions.</li><li>Experience in designing and building complete information flow moving and transforming data for ODS, Staging, Data Warehousing and Data Marts, MDM, including Middleware Integrations.</li><li>Experience with implementing audit, balance and control mechanism in data solutions.</li><li>Strong understanding of Middleware concepts for modern integration infrastructures such as API management and ESB, and MDM Concepts.</li><li>Has in-depth understanding of development best practices.</li><li>Has mastered the tools needed to debug and diagnose issues in any type of environment.</li><li>Has Subject Matter expertise in multiple components and good understanding of all components.</li><li>Strong analytical skills related to middleware products.</li><li>Perform peer reviews and take ownership of the application or API development and identify any potential defects.</li><li>Experience working on a CI/CD pipeline is a plus.</li><li>Experience with source control repository system such as TFS or GIT is preferred.</li><li>Efficiently work in Agile environment. Familiarity with tracking tools such as JIRA is a plus.</li><li>Experience working on Banking and Financial domain is preferred.</li><li>Passionate about learning new technologies and solving hard problems in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Proven ability to work within a team environment and interacting with data professionals and business data SME’s throughout the organization</li><li>Desire to work in a fast growing environment with strong time management ability</li><li>Demonstrates strong analytical and problem solving skills.</li><li>Must be self-directed and have excellent initiative and organization skills.</li><li>Proven track record of meeting commitments with the highest standards of ethics and integrity.</li></ul><p><br></p>From our first day in business, Wintrust has been proud to serve a variety of unique communities and people from all walks of life. To be Chicago’s Bank® and Wisconsin's Bank®, we need to reflect that diversity both in all the communities we serve, the people we employ, the organizations we work with, and our banking and lending practices. Wintrust Financial Corporation, including community banking and financial services subsidiaries, is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran or any other characteristic protected by law.<p><br></p>

Wintrust operates fifteen community bank subsidiaries with over 170 banking locations in the greater Chicago and southern Wisconsin market areas. Additionally, Wintrust operates various non-bank business units including commercial and life insurance premium financing, short-term accounts receivable financing, out-sourced administrative services, mortgage origination and purchase, wealth management services and qualified intermediary services for tax-deferred exchanges.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>An award-winning culture! We are rated a Top Workplace by the Chicago Tribune (past 8 years) and Employee Recommended award by the Globe &amp; Mail (past 6 years)</li><li>Competitive pay and discretionary or incentive bonus eligible</li><li>Comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, vision, life, a 401k plan with a generous company match and tuition reimbursement to name a few</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Why join this team? </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We hold ourselves accountable to high standards, share wins, operate ethically, and have fun</li><li>Master Data Management (MDM) team members play a key part in the Wintrust Digital Journey supporting enterprise applications including CRM, Digital Banking, Account Opening Platform, LOS etc.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Advanced Middleware Developer is a key position within the Data Management team, responsible for the development, test and implementation of best coding practices in complex Integration solutions for the organization, including application connectivity, Performance, Security and audit. This role will be engaged in all phases of the API lifecycle, and follows all the best practices that were put in place. Successful candidate will have a proven track record demonstrating sound technical and business knowledge.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, development and continuous improvement of complex and critical data projects.</li><li>Design and develop data ingestion frameworks, leveraging open source tools and data processing frameworks.</li><li>Enhance data solutions that enables seamless integration and flow of data across the data ecosystem.</li><li>Participate in and support initiatives outside of main area of responsibility.</li><li>Support/enhance/create data solutions to ensure business continuity, ensuring all related processes meets best-in-class standards offering high performance.</li><li>Support and maintain existing integration solutions for Middleware systems for operational and analytical applications.</li><li>Required to work in other areas of Data Enablement lifecycle as needed.</li><li>Work on the API specification documentation.</li><li>Ensure DevOps practices are implemented for all data solutions.</li><li>Participate in all types of testing and triages.</li><li>Required to work in other areas of Data Enablement lifecycle, including batch and real time processes using SQL Server, SSIS ETL/ETL, MuleSoft as needed.</li><li>Onboard the new team members to the projects from both technical and business standpoint.</li><li>Analyze the requirements and prepare technical specifications and detail level design documents.</li><li>Conducts research and provide technology solutions.</li><li>Participates in code reviews.</li><li>Takes ownership of projects.</li><li>Supports and guides junior team members.</li><li>Serves as resource to internal and third-party team members on escalated issues and analyzing and designing specifications for less experienced team members</li><li>Pursues self-development and effective relationships with others by sharing resources, information, and knowledge with coworkers and customers.</li><li>Seeks opportunities to deliver continuous process improvement, automating manual processes and optimizing data delivery.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree with 3+ years’ experience or Master’s degree with 2+ years’ experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or other quantitative field.</li><li>2+ years’ experience in Application or API development - designing, implementing data persistence, data processing, data integration and MDM Solutions.</li><li>Experience in designing and building complete information flow moving and transforming data for ODS, Staging, Data Warehousing and Data Marts, MDM, including Middleware Integrations.</li><li>Experience with implementing audit, balance and control mechanism in data solutions.</li><li>Strong understanding of Middleware concepts for modern integration infrastructures such as API management and ESB, and MDM Concepts.</li><li>Has in-depth understanding of development best practices.</li><li>Has mastered the tools needed to debug and diagnose issues in any type of environment.</li><li>Has Subject Matter expertise in multiple components and good understanding of all components.</li><li>Strong analytical skills related to middleware products.</li><li>Perform peer reviews and take ownership of the application or API development and identify any potential defects.</li><li>Experience working on a CI/CD pipeline is a plus.</li><li>Experience with source control repository system such as TFS or GIT is preferred.</li><li>Efficiently work in Agile environment. Familiarity with tracking tools such as JIRA is a plus.</li><li>Experience working on Banking and Financial domain is preferred.</li><li>Passionate about learning new technologies and solving hard problems in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Proven ability to work within a team environment and interacting with data professionals and business data SME’s throughout the organization</li><li>Desire to work in a fast growing environment with strong time management ability</li><li>Demonstrates strong analytical and problem solving skills.</li><li>Must be self-directed and have excellent initiative and organization skills.</li><li>Proven track record of meeting commitments with the highest standards of ethics and integrity.</li></ul><p><br></p>From our first day in business, Wintrust has been proud to serve a variety of unique communities and people from all walks of life. To be Chicago’s Bank® and Wisconsin's Bank®, we need to reflect that diversity both in all the communities we serve, the people we employ, the organizations we work with, and our banking and lending practices. Wintrust Financial Corporation, including community banking and financial services subsidiaries, is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran or any other characteristic protected by law.<p><br></p>

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br><br></strong>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.Key Roles and Responsibilities: Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. Included in higher complexity design work, with input to the design expected. Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. Knowledge, Skills and Attributes: Good understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles Demonstrates project management and administration ability Good project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments Demonstrate customer engagement skills Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge Good verbal communication skills Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems Ability to work under pressure Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members Good understanding of project management principles Academic Qualifications and Certifications: Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent Project management certification Required Experience: Solid work experience in a technical implementation engineering or similar role Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations Good project administration and documentation experience Report writing experience Basic project management #ownyourfuture<br><br><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?<br><br></strong>Standard career level descriptor for job level:<br><ul><li> Have wide-ranging experience</li><li> Uses professional concepts and company objectives to solve complex issues in creative ways</li><li> Networks with others outside own area of expertise</li><li> Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results</li><li> May coordinate others’ activities</li><li> Typically requires significant related experience with a Bachelor’s or equivalent degree</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer, Backend - Developer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only </li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $125 – $135/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Solid Infrastructure background with 1+ years of industry ML Engineering &amp; systems experience.</li><li>Background in Machine Learning and related fields (the equivalent of B.S. degree or above in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Machine Learning, Operation Research, Statistics, Data Science or related engineering fields).</li><li>Practical experience designing &amp; architecting large scale machine learning systems.</li><li>Strong engineering and coding skills, with ability to write high performance production code. Proficiency in Java, Python, Scala, and/or other equivalent languages.</li><li>You have built distributed services with technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, Spark etc.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Machine learning frameworks &amp; technologies such as Tensorflow / TFX, Pytorch, Kubeflow.</li><li>Preferred proficiency with data pipelines in Spark.</li><li>Preferred proficiency in developing ML infrastructure at a scale</li><li>Experience with streaming data and its application to ML solutions is a plus.</li><li>You have strong analytical and quantitative skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration skills as well as both verbal and written communication skills.<br><br></li></ul><strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>This is a contract position for a Sr. Software/ML Engineer reporting to the Senior Engineering Manager, ML Feature Systems.<br><br><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6684<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Java Developer with GCP
description: <u><strong>Your Impact:</strong></u><p><br></p>Rauland is looking for a talented and passionate Embedded Engineer who wants to make an impact in the medical &amp; educational space. We are seeking an experienced developer who will help us build and enhance tools and applications that are used by thousands of healthcare providers and patients worldwide for the latest in acute and long-term care facilities and the applications used by the educational institutions.<p><br></p><u><strong>What You'll Do:</strong></u><ul><li> Design and buildout firmware for a new generation of Rauland designed hardware SKUs. </li><li> Participate in all aspects of the software development life cycle from requirements review to product verification. </li><li> Create or review:</li><ul><li> System, sub-system and functional requirements </li><li> Software architecture and detailed design documents </li><li> Software verification plans </li><li> Software build and deployment plans. </li></ul><li> Participate in code inspections. </li><li> Work with the assigned software architect to design and code solutions. </li><li> Work with verification and validation engineers to resolve test failures. </li><li> Work with the technical support group to troubleshoot field problems. </li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong> Do You Have?... </strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li> A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent. </li><li> At least 5 years development experience in design and implementation of multi-task, event-driven real time embedded development. </li><li> Expertise with development tools for revision control, bug tracking, peer code review, etc. </li><li> Linux kernel development and integration </li><li> Low Level driver development </li><li> Integrating board support packages from RTOS vendors </li><li> Excellent knowledge of OS coding techniques, IP protocols, interfaces and hardware subsystems </li><li> Developing firmware using an RTOS </li><li> Integrating hardware and firmware </li><li> Codec programming and integration </li><li> Experience reading schematics and data sheets for components. </li><li> Experience using emulators and hardware debugging tools. </li><li> Experience with IAR Workbench or similar embedded IDEs. </li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Why Us?</u></strong><p><br></p>Rauland, a division of AMETEK, is a business unit in the Measurement, Communications and Technologies division of AMETEK. We are a leader in integrated communications technology, designing and manufacturing Nurse Call Systems for the medical industry and school critical communication systems for the education K-12 market.<p><br></p>Website: www.rauland.com<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Salary Minimum:<p><br></p>Salary Maximum:<p><br></p>Incentive:<p><br></p>Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.<br><br>AMETEK is committed to making a safer, sustainable, and more productive world a reality. We use differentiated technology solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. We employ 18,500 colleagues, in 30 countries, that are grounded by our core values: Ethics and Integrity, Respect for the Individual, Diversity and Inclusion, Teamwork, and Social Responsibility. AMETEK (NYSE:AME) is a component of the S&amp;P 500. Visit www.ametek.com for more information.<br><br>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call 1 (866) 263-8359.

title: Java Developer with GCP
description: <strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>Performs and implements assignments that impact important /complicated components/processes of the specified functional area of the Technology operation. Work is received in short- and mid-term assignments that are important / complicated undertakings and regularly require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of approved methods.<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities</strong> <ul><li>Actively participates in the daily operational activities that impact important components / processes of the of the IT work function, and may include responsibilities, such as:</li><ul><li>Execution of deployment operations to monitor and improve on pre-release, upgrades and current versions of software. </li><li>Evaluating compatibility of programs with existing hardware and/or software features. </li><li>Development of protocols to support established standards. </li><li>Improving operation and monitoring of advanced or complex features. </li><li>Development of processes and interface requirements. </li><li>Data development and definition of acceptance criteria. </li></ul><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. </li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. Facilitates elimination of problems and roadblocks before they occur. </li><li>Works cross-functionally to accomplish assignments. Interacts with internal and external peers and managers to exchange complex information related to areas of specialization. </li><li>Mentors less experienced members of the team. </li><li>May assist in live site support and incident resolution that may include on-call rotation. </li></ul><strong>An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans<br><br></strong><strong>About Walgreens And WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide."<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree and at least 2 years of experience in a technical engineering role, such as software development, release management, deployment engineering, site operations, technical operations or similar OR High school / GED and at least 5 years of experience in a technical engineering role, such as software development, release management, deployment engineering, site operations, technical operations or similar. </li><li>Experience in Technology infrastructure, such as Network, Monitoring, Systems, Databases, etc. </li><li>Experience establishing &amp; maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization, in the business community &amp; with vendors. </li><li>Experience using time management skills such as prioritizing/organizing and tracking details and meeting deadlines of multiple projects with varying completion dates</li><li>Minimum 3 years with InTune. </li><li>Experience analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions. </li><li>Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics</li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems. </li><li>Experience with programming languages</li><li>Knowledge of IT technologies</li></ul>

To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide."<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree and at least 2 years of experience in a technical engineering role, such as software development, release management, deployment engineering, site operations, technical operations or similar OR High school / GED and at least 5 years of experience in a technical engineering role, such as software development, release management, deployment engineering, site operations, technical operations or similar. </li><li>Experience in Technology infrastructure, such as Network, Monitoring, Systems, Databases, etc. </li><li>Experience establishing &amp; maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization, in the business community &amp; with vendors. </li><li>Experience using time management skills such as prioritizing/organizing and tracking details and meeting deadlines of multiple projects with varying completion dates</li><li>Minimum 3 years with InTune. </li><li>Experience analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions. </li><li>Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics</li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems. </li><li>Experience with programming languages</li><li>Knowledge of IT technologies</li></ul>

title: Full Stack Developer
description: <ul><li>READY TO DO YOUR PART AND HELP PROTECT OUR TROOPS?* I have the position for you! My client is currently hiring for an Embedded Software Engineer to develop products to help protect our troops. In this position you will be working with Embedded C/C++ within VxWorks operating systems for software development. This position requires you to be doing both Embedded C development along with C++ Object Oriented Programming with some being OOD development, design patterns, and deeper OO concepts. This also includes Embedded Software Development and doing application level while working with many different communication protocols and working with RF Electronic Warfare Systems as part of a large team and program.</li><li>Skills:*</li><li>VxWorks</li><li>Clearance</li><li>C/C++</li><li>Embedded C</li><li>Linux</li><li>RTOS</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>Must have an active secret clearance as they are putting them on programs asap for cleared work</li><li>Must have experience in real-time system</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>PTO</li><li>Experience Level:* 3+ years of experience working with C/C++<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Adobe Campaign Classic developer (Remote)
description: <strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. </li><li>Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications</li><li>Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. </li><li>Participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. </li><li>Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. </li><li>Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. </li><li>Builds productive internal/external working relationships. </li><li>Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Usually works with some supervision, conferring with superiors on unusual or complex matters</li><li>Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. </li><li>Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization</li><li>Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. </li><li>Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities. </li><li>Acts as individual contributor as well as team member</li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. </li><li>Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. </li><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. </li></ul><strong>About Walgreens and WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree and at least 2 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience OR High School/ GED and at least 4 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience</li><li>Experience writing code for applications or automation</li><li>Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices, APIs or mobile applications</li><li>Experience building, testing applications or automation</li><li>Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle</li><li>Experience creating coding solutions to fix moderate problems/issues</li><li>Willing to travel up to 5% of the time for business purposes (domestically and/or internationally). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong> <ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar field</li><li> Experience working in an Agile environment</li><ul><li>At least 2 years of progressively complex related experience. </li></ul><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems</li><li>DevOps</li><li>2+ years of on experience is Deployment automation for various applications IaaS, PaaS platforms</li><li>2+ years of hands-on experience in automation software like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform or equivalent</li><li>Good knowledge of GIT workflows and Repo management</li><li>Excellent knowledge in implement of CI/CD pipelines for Cloud deployments using containers/Docker</li><li>Working knowledge of Kubernetes and microservices architecture and other DevOps tooling and Linux environments</li><li>Working knowledge or experience of software development for Web and Mobile applications in agile environments</li><li>Web/backend Developer</li><li>Previous experience with full stack development ranging from front-end user interfaces to back-end systems</li><li>Proficient in back-end languages like Java, Node/Typescript, .NET, Python etc. with exposure to performance optimization of high traffic &amp; scalable services</li><li>Hands on with modern UI frameworks like React with good knowledge of front-end design pattern (stateless components, conditional rendering, controlled components, hooks etc.)</li><li>Excellent knowledge of distributed SQL (e.g., Oracle, MySQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra) design &amp; consumption patterns</li><li>Have an exposure to implementation, capacity planning &amp; performance tuning of Cloud technologies – Azure (ACS, AKS), Google, IBM, AWS or Cloud Foundry</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations</li><li>Mobile Developer</li><li>2 years of Mobile App development experience and hands on skills in Swift, SwiftUI, Objective C ( iOS)</li><li>2 Years of Mobile App development experience and hands-on skills in Kotlin ( Android)</li><li>Experience in building client applications consuming JSON based on APIs</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations</li><li>Software Engineer in Test</li><li>3+ years of experience as an SDET, Developer, or strong Automation Engineer</li><li>Experience developing automation in at least one OO language - Java, C#/C++, Python or web based technologies</li><li>Proven experience creating automation frameworks and tools to support test automation</li><li>Experience working in a Microservices based architecture in a cloud native environment</li><li>Data &amp; Analytics</li><li>2 years of experience in integrating, transforming and consolidating data from various structured and unstructured data systems for building analytics solutions in any cloud Platforms: Microsoft Azure, AWS or GCP</li><li>Experience with relational and NoSQL databases such as Cosmos, Cassandra</li><li>2 years of Experience in SQL, Java or Python programming</li><li>Experience in Data Pipeline and integration workflow management tools: Talend, Store Proc, Change Data Capture (CDC), Spark &amp; Azure API</li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending fixes to resolve problems</li><li>Knowledge in Azure cloud technologies like Data Flow, Data Bricks, Azure Synapse, Power BI Analytics</li><li>Experience in any of reporting tools like Power BI, Business objects, Cognos or Tableau</li></ul>

title: Development Engineer
description: <strong>Chicago Aerospace Engineering Tutor Jobs<br><br></strong>The Varsity Tutors platform has thousands of students looking for online Aerospace Engineering tutors nationally and in Chicago. As a tutor who uses the Varsity Tutors platform, you can earn good money, choose your own hours, and truly make a difference in the lives of your students.<br><br><strong>Why join our platform?<br></strong><ul><li>Enjoy competitive rates and get paid 2x per week.</li><li>Choose to tutor as much or as little as you want.</li><li>Set your own hours and schedule.</li><li>Get paired with students best-suited to your teaching style and preferences (from thousands of potential clients).</li><li>Tutor online (i.e. “work remotely”) using our purpose-built Live Learning Platform.</li><li>Students can take adaptive assessments through the platform and share results to help you decide where to focus.</li><li>We collect payment from the customers, so all you have to do is invoice the session.<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We Look For In a Tutor<br></u></strong><ul><li>You have excellent communication skills and a friendly, approachable personality.</li><li>You can show subject-matter expertise in Aerospace Engineering.</li><li>You have the ability to personalize lessons for each student.<br></li></ul><strong>Discover all the ways you can reach students through the online platform:<br></strong><ul><li>1-on-1 Online Tutoring: connect with an individual student for a highly personalized learning experience.</li><li>Small Group Classes: meet with small groups (typically 7-9 students) for a more collaborative learning experience.</li><li>Large Live Classes: share your knowledge with hundreds of students at a time.</li><li>Instant Tutoring: accept subject-specific, on-demand tutoring sessions whenever you’d like.<br></li></ul><strong><u>About Varsity Tutors And 1-on-1 Online Tutoring<br><br></u></strong>Our mission is to transform the way people learn. We do this by leveraging advanced technology, AI, and the latest in learning science to facilitate a personalized learning experience. With 1-on-1 Online Tutoring, individual students are connected with tutors for a highly personalized learning experience. We believe our thoughtful approach to matching students with the right tutors can improve outcomes, and we look forward to connecting you with students hungry to learn.<br><br><em>Please note: Varsity Tutors does not contract in: Alaska, California, Delaware, Hawaii, Maine, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia or Puerto Rico.</em>

As a tutor who uses the Varsity Tutors platform, you can earn good money, choose your own hours, and truly make a difference in the lives of your students.<br><br><strong>Why join our platform?<br></strong><ul><li>Enjoy competitive rates and get paid 2x per week.</li><li>Choose to tutor as much or as little as you want.</li><li>Set your own hours and schedule.</li><li>Get paired with students best-suited to your teaching style and preferences (from thousands of potential clients).</li><li>Tutor online (i.e. “work remotely”) using our purpose-built Live Learning Platform.</li><li>Students can take adaptive assessments through the platform and share results to help you decide where to focus.</li><li>We collect payment from the customers, so all you have to do is invoice the session.<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We Look For In a Tutor<br></u></strong><ul><li>You have excellent communication skills and a friendly, approachable personality.</li><li>You can show subject-matter expertise in Aerospace Engineering.</li><li>You have the ability to personalize lessons for each student.<br></li></ul><strong>Discover all the ways you can reach students through the online platform:<br></strong><ul><li>1-on-1 Online Tutoring: connect with an individual student for a highly personalized learning experience.</li><li>Small Group Classes: meet with small groups (typically 7-9 students) for a more collaborative learning experience.</li><li>Large Live Classes: share your knowledge with hundreds of students at a time.</li><li>Instant Tutoring: accept subject-specific, on-demand tutoring sessions whenever you’d like.<br></li></ul><strong><u>About Varsity Tutors And 1-on-1 Online Tutoring<br><br></u></strong>Our mission is to transform the way people learn. We do this by leveraging advanced technology, AI, and the latest in learning science to facilitate a personalized learning experience. With 1-on-1 Online Tutoring, individual students are connected with tutors for a highly personalized learning experience. We believe our thoughtful approach to matching students with the right tutors can improve outcomes, and we look forward to connecting you with students hungry to learn.<br><br><em>Please note: Varsity Tutors does not contract in: Alaska, California, Delaware, Hawaii, Maine, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia or Puerto Rico.</em>

title: Java Security Engineer
description: <p><strong>Only 10+ Years Experience candidate Required.</strong></p><p>Job Duration: Multi-year engagement</p><ul><li>Duties: Perform technology and architecture upgrades to ensure the stability of applications in the DEP portfolio.</li><li>Learn new skills, technologies, and languages to support the DEP application portfolio.</li><li>Develop J2EE applications.</li><li>Work closely with customers, users, and team members to understand business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality technical solutions.</li><li>Work as part of a project team directed by a project manager.</li><li>Required Experience:10+ years experience in Java Frameworks such as Spring, Spring Boot, Struts 2/Tiles, Servlets/JSP, JPA 2/Hibernate</li><li>5+ years experience in XML, HTML and CSS</li><li>2+ years experience with Oracle PL/SQL</li><li>Experience using continuous integration tools, preferably Jenkins</li><li>Experience using git source control in a team environment</li><li>Experience using Jenkins, Gitlab, Maven 3</li><li>Experience developing web services, preferably RESTful web services</li><li>Knowledge of relational and object-oriented database designs</li><li>Knowledge of object-oriented design methodologies</li><li>Knowledge of Information Systems Development Methodology (ISDM)</li><li>Knowledge of database security, including role-based security</li><li>Ability to be creative, to use sound judgment, and to display foresight to identify potential problems and design/specifications and assigned application software systems</li><li>Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.</li><li>Ability to work independently.</li><li>Ability to work as part of a team.</li><li>Ability to solve problems and manage issues effectively, efficiently, and proactively.</li><li>Strong deadline and task management skills.</li><li>Ability to determine work priorities and ensure proper completion of work assignments</li><li>Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently, both verbally and in writing.</li><li>Desired Experience:Familiarity with Agile development, specifically Scrum, Extreme Programming (XP) and Kanban.</li><li>Experience in web development leveraging XML and CSS</li><li>Experience with JQuery (Javascript library)</li><li>Experience with additional Javascript frameworks, such as AngularJS, NodeJS, and React</li><li>Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and container-based application development, debugging, deployment, and orchestration</li><li>Experience with CI/CD pipelines</li><li>Experience with stateless applications</li><li>Experience with Bash and other Linux/UNIX shell environments</li><li>Experience with responsive design frameworks, preferably Bootstrap</li><li>Experience using Gitlab and Jenkins</li><li>Experience with environmental regulatory business processes and practice</li></ul><p><br></p>

title: Advanced Middleware Developer
description: Softrams is looking for a strong Product Manager with experience in creating and developing a vision of a product from start to finish. This role is an integral part of a highly collaborative and agile team that supports and builds modern, standards-based responsive web applications for mission-critical health IT solutions.<br><br><em>Softrams is one of the fastest growing Digital Services firm in the Washington Metropolitan regions crafting human centered, empowering digital services with focus on HX, AI, Cloud, DevOps and Cyber Security. Offices in Leesburg VA, Baltimore MD and Plano TX and teams across USA.<br></em><ul><li> Recognized as one of the Top Workplaces in Technology (2021)</li><li> INC 5000, Fastest growing companies in America (2nd year in a row)</li><li> Washington Business Journal Top 75 Fastest Growing Companies in Greater Washington area</li><li> 2020 NXT UP - Top Federal Emerging Technology and consulting firms</li><li> 2020 Inaugural DC Metro’s Most Successful Companies</li><li> 2020 Washington Technology Fast 50</li><li> NVTC Tech 100 (2019, 2020)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Roles And Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Lead a dynamic and multi-functional team to create a vision, develop, and enhance products on a day-to-day basis.</li><li> Translate business strategies into products requirements that capture customer needs and address pain-points.</li><li> Be a dynamic product owner familiar with Agile methodology who will rally the team and work in a highly collaborative environment.</li><li> Analyze and understand complex business, policy and engineering challenges, identify ways to improve products, services and operations.</li><li> Identify problems and meet needs of internal and external customers, define and prioritize product requirements, lead agile development process, execute timely product launches, continuously enhance and optimize performance</li><li> Identify product and feature success metrics, measure and monitor performance, conduct data analytics to prioritize future development, and identify new product opportunities</li><li> Serve as a primary representative for project teams and internal stakeholders, articulate data analytics to drive value to business partners</li><li> Work with Product Analysts to capture product requirements as robust user stories. Demonstrate clear proficiency in using data to drive business decisions.</li><li> Product Manager considers various business and engineering factors like cost, risk, feasibility and end user experience in delivering products and solutions for our organization.</li><li> Stay current with the policy and strategy changes at the customer and Healthcare industry in general.</li><li> Work with customer, users, and other contractors to gather, understand and document business, functional, technical &amp; non-technical requirements.</li><li> Works closely with the Product Owner and Agency leads to develop Agile documentation and oversees quality assurance activities (SOPS, QA processes, metrics, reporting) for the products.</li><li> Conduct Product Analysis sessions, work group calls and engage customers to provide requirements and feedback.</li><li> Conduct user research and usability testing.</li><li> Follow agile methodology (Scrum/Kanban) and develop user stories with robust acceptance criteria.</li><li> Working with sprint team to implement, accept, and accept user stories as defined.</li><li> Develop Change Requests per established policies and procedures.</li><li> Provide clear qualitative and quantitative information to teams and stakeholders.</li><li> Support change control processes established to monitor and control product vision.</li><li> Working with multiple teams in building large and complex products using small &amp; incremental delivery</li><li> Working with product team and stakeholders in delivering incremental working software with end-to-end user experience in mind.</li><li> Understanding and interpreting complex data and business processes to modernize legacy systems to improve the user experience.</li><li> Adhering to agile &amp; iterative development practices.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Experience in an Agile environment, leading agile sprint teams and using agile collaboration tools (Jira, confluence, etc.).</li><li> Demonstrated ability to diagnose business problems and come up with product roadmaps and timelines for convincing parties to secure funding for recommended product implementation.</li><li> Demonstrated ability to analyze complex data and business for business operations; demonstrated ability to understand user needs for system and interfaces and come up with requirement documentation. Able to perform end-to-end business process analysis to identify gaps and come up with improvements.</li><li> Verifiable experience with delivery management involving managing work across multiple teams, building and nurturing talent pipelines and manage time, scope and cost for required product implementation.</li><li> Must be able to exercise critical and rational thinking to identify alternate solution, strengths &amp; weakness of each options, documenting and discussing them with stakeholders to inform decisions.</li><li> Must have demonstrated experience in documenting complex technical and business problems in a simple &amp; intuitive manner that others can understand.</li><li> Must show appetite for active learning, embracing change and mentoring others in the organization.</li><li> Knowledge of Healthcare, Medicare &amp; Medicaid systems &amp; data.</li><li> 5+ years of total experience as a product manager with Healthcare IT programs.</li><li> 8+ years of experience as a product owner, business analyst, product analyst, leading requirements capture, management and analysis activities along all phases of the agile software development and developing business process models.</li><li> 8+ years of experience in Health Care data specifically Medicaid/Medicare is required.</li><li> Excellent oral and written communication skills.</li><li> Must be able to effectively and professionally communicate to management, peers and customers as well as demonstrate sound judgment/reasoning skills.</li><li> Expertise with Agile tools like JIRA, Confluence, Slack etc.</li><li> Creative, visionary, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.</li><li> As part of company’s growth efforts, employee from time to time participates in coding and design challenges to build working prototypes.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Demonstrated ability come up with System designs, process flows and Concept of Operations for large complex systems</li><li> Demonstrated experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).</li><li> Preferred certifications PMI-ACP, CPM, CSM and/or PSM certification(s)</li><li> Knowledge of Healthcare, Medicare and Medicaid systems and data is a plus.</li><li> 5+ years of experience working with Federal Healthcare IT Projects. Other government contract project management experience will be considered.</li><li> 5+ years of experience with Drug and Pharmacy programs.</li><li> Knowledge of process workflow and Business Process modeling will be plus.</li><li> Agile certifications such as Certified Product Owner, SAFe Product Owner Product Manager are a plus</li><li> PMP certification or Business Analyst certification is plus<br></li></ul><strong>Public Trust Clearance<br><br></strong>This role requires the hired candidate to go through public clearance. A minimum of 3 years of stay in the U.S. within the last 5 years is a must to be eligible to qualify for public trust clearance sponsorship.<br><br><strong><u>Benefits And Perks<br></u></strong><ul><li> 65%-75% company sponsored (including dependents) premiums towards Medical, Dental &amp; Vision Insurance. 100% employer sponsored STD, LTD &amp; Life Insurance (min $100K). Voluntary Life insurance option available.</li><li> Retirement 401(k) Plan with employer matching. Immediate vesting.</li><li> Vacation &amp; Sick leaves</li><li> Discretionary Bonus, Spot awards, Gifts, Tenure based rewards.</li><li> Company sponsored role based certifications/trainings.</li><li> Monthly Doordash DashPass subscription.</li><li> Group discounts via LifeMart ADP<br></li></ul><strong>Work Location<br><br></strong><em>Softrams is a 100% remote at the moment and we expect some of our employees to be onsite (Woodlawn, MD) 2-3 times a week post-covid especially if they are customer facing or if there are important team meetings. Softrams works in eastern zone and standard work hours are 9 AM to 5 PM with flexibility around the start and end times based on the individual smaller teams. </em><strong><em>This role qualifies for 100% remote for the right candidate.<br><br></em></strong><strong><u>About Softrams<br><br></u></strong><em>Softrams is a Maryland &amp; Virginia-based small business information technology, consulting, and solutions provider specializing in emerging technologies for UX/UI, Mobile Apps, DevOps, Big Data Analytics, Data Science, and Cyber Security. We offer innovative technology implementations and build customer-centric services that are simple, intuitive, scalable, efficient and most importantly usable.<br><br></em><em>Softrams is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, nation origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

title: Software Engineer, Full Stack - Developer
description: <strong>Salary: $80k + $1,000/month MVA </strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Downers Grove, IL</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a Region Solutions Engineer to help support multiple locations. This position will be based in Downers Grove, IL; however, it may be necessary to travel to other offices or customer locations on an occasional basis. Some off hours work may be required.<p><br></p><ul><li>As a Region Solutions Engineer, you will be involved in the technical design, architecture, qualification and presentation of security solutions offered by Securitas. These include the integration of guarding services with access control, cameras, video analytics, remote monitoring services, intrusion detection, and alarm services. You will be required to work with customers to define their requirements, introduce specific technologies which meet those requirements, design, architect, and qualify proposed solutions, create Visio infrastructure topologies, proposals, and statements of work specific to the solutions to be offered and then present/review them with the customer.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, AD&amp;D and Disability Insurance, plus 401k options.</li><li>Discounts (Retail, Phone Plans, Rentals &amp; many more)</li><li>Employee Assistance Program &amp; much more!</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>Weekly Pay</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Essential Functions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be able to research specific technology questions or topics and be comfortable with formal presentations or "chalk talks" of various technologies.</li><li>May be required to step into a project management role as needed.</li><li>Must work alongside the Technology Operations Management Team who will be responsible for the installation and maintenance of the sold systems.</li><li>Ability to pursue and achieve professional certifications will be required.</li><li>Interface with clients, AVPs, DMs, BDMs serving as the technical expert for security systems</li><li>Coordinate with field managers as needed to provide technology solutions (and information about such) to their clients and prospects</li><li>Attend client/prospect meetings to qualify, provide technology advice and information, present technology ideas, design and develop technology (service and equipment) solutions</li><li>Respond to bids and RFPs</li><li>Generate leads from existing clients and from new prospects</li><li>Manage leads and provide regular accounting of sales / prospect activity</li><li>Manage and report on sales and forecasting activity</li><li>Field calls from DMs, BDMs, AVPs and prospects regarding technology and systems</li><li>Create and present Integrated Guarding sales proposals (in conjunction with IGSC)</li><li>Use Google maps and Visio to create designs for the sales process</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and architect Security Systems</li><li>Provide scope of work and design documents</li><li>Use Google maps and Visio to create designs which are ready to handoff to engineers</li><li>Coordinate with Technology Project Ensure smooth hand-off for implementation</li><li>Work with Prospects and Technology Project Manager (as needed) to refine and define project scope prior to contract finalization </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 2 years of previous experience in a project management role with a Value Added Reseller (VAR) and/or a Technology Manufacturer in the Security Systems Industry</li><li>At least 2 years technical experience with security systems including design and architecture</li><li>4 year college degree is preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>Come join our team and help make our world a safer place.<p><br></p>Apply online: https://ekaw.fa.us2.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX<p><br></p>See a different world.<p><br></p>IDFPR License #122-000899<p><br></p>EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabilities<p><br></p>#AF-NCSCHICILHP<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>Securitas employees come from all walks of life, bringing with them a variety of distinctive skills and perspectives. United through our common purpose, we provide the security needed to safeguard our clients' assets and people. Our core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are represented by the three red dots in the Securitas logo. If you live by these values, we're looking for you to join the Securitas team.<p><br></p><strong>About The Team</strong><p><br></p>Our Company Mission:<p><br></p>Securitas' mission is to protect homes, workplaces, and communities by providing the security services they need to protect their assets, safeguard their people, and maintain their ability to generate profits.<p><br></p>Our Values:<p><br></p>Securitas' core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are the foundation for our employees to build trust with customers, colleagues, and the surrounding community.<p><br></p>Integrity:<p><br></p>Securitas employees are honest and trusted by customers to safeguard their premises and valuables. We don't compromise on integrity and create an open forum for our employees and customers to voice opinions, report improprieties, and share information.<p><br></p>Vigilance:<p><br></p>Seeing, hearing, and evaluating. A Securitas employee is always attentive and often notices things that others don't. Their vigilance is necessary in order to be aware of potential risks or incidents that may take place on our customers' premises.<p><br></p>Helpfulness:<p><br></p>As part of an on-going effort to ensure safety, Securitas employees are always ready to help if an incident occurs that requires intervention regardless of whether or not it is directly related to their job.

alongside the Technology Operations Management Team who will be responsible for the installation and maintenance of the sold systems.</li><li>Ability to pursue and achieve professional certifications will be required.</li><li>Interface with clients, AVPs, DMs, BDMs serving as the technical expert for security systems</li><li>Coordinate with field managers as needed to provide technology solutions (and information about such) to their clients and prospects</li><li>Attend client/prospect meetings to qualify, provide technology advice and information, present technology ideas, design and develop technology (service and equipment) solutions</li><li>Respond to bids and RFPs</li><li>Generate leads from existing clients and from new prospects</li><li>Manage leads and provide regular accounting of sales / prospect activity</li><li>Manage and report on sales and forecasting activity</li><li>Field calls from DMs, BDMs, AVPs and prospects regarding technology and systems</li><li>Create and present Integrated Guarding sales proposals (in conjunction with IGSC)</li><li>Use Google maps and Visio to create designs for the sales process</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and architect Security Systems</li><li>Provide scope of work and design documents</li><li>Use Google maps and Visio to create designs which are ready to handoff to engineers</li><li>Coordinate with Technology Project Ensure smooth hand-off for implementation</li><li>Work with Prospects and Technology Project Manager (as needed) to refine and define project scope prior to contract finalization </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 2 years of previous experience in a project management role with a Value Added Reseller (VAR) and/or a Technology Manufacturer in the Security Systems Industry</li><li>At least 2 years technical experience with security systems including design and architecture</li><li>4 year college degree is preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>Come join our team and help make our world a safer place.<p><br></p>Apply online: https://ekaw.fa.us2.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX<p><br></p>See a different world.<p><br></p>IDFPR License #122-000899<p><br></p>EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabilities<p><br></p>#AF-NCSCHICILHP<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>Securitas employees come from all walks of life, bringing with them a variety of distinctive skills and perspectives. United through our common purpose, we provide the security needed to safeguard our clients' assets and people. Our core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are represented by the three red dots in the Securitas logo. If you live by these values, we're looking for you to join the Securitas team.<p><br></p><strong>About The Team</strong><p><br></p>Our Company Mission:<p><br></p>Securitas' mission is to protect homes, workplaces, and communities by providing the security services they need to protect their assets, safeguard their people, and maintain their ability to generate profits.<p><br></p>Our Values:<p><br></p>Securitas' core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are the foundation for our employees to build trust with customers, colleagues, and the surrounding community.<p><br></p>Integrity:<p><br></p>Securitas employees are honest and trusted by customers to safeguard their premises and valuables. We don't compromise on integrity and create an open forum for our employees and customers to voice opinions, report improprieties, and share information.<p><br></p>Vigilance:<p><br></p>Seeing, hearing, and evaluating. A Securitas employee is always attentive and often notices things that others don't. Their vigilance is necessary in order to be aware of potential risks or incidents that may take place on our customers' premises.<p><br></p>Helpfulness:<p><br></p>As part of an on-going effort to ensure safety, Securitas employees are always ready to help if an incident occurs that requires intervention regardless of whether or not it is directly related to their job.

title: Embedded Engineer
description: <ul><li>Be apart of sports and technology company expanding massively |Mobile Opportunity, using React Native with team of 6<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>The client focuses on Youth Sports and Development. The offer a robust platform that organizes national events, practice and game schedules as well as individual athletes data. Having experienced tremendous growth in recent years they are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to play a key role in continuing to grow their platform.<br><br>They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports team in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M on boarded users. They have a clear career path with a chance to grow within the company to a managerial or leader role. They develop greenfield projects designed to enhance the experience of youth athletes and simplify the process of scheduling and making payments for their parents.<br><br>This is a hybrid opportunity with commute to the office required once a week.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Write clean, scalable code using React Native</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences</li><li>Develop SQL Database-driven web interfaces</li><li>Create and test prototype when needed</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in Fullstack capacity</li><li>Use, rework and adapt existing web application for mobile apps <br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>4 + years of software development experience</li><li>Experience coding in React native</li><li>Experience working on Mobile applications</li><li>Strong attention to detail, looks to input creative solutions to help minimize excess redundancies </li><li>Experience with SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience </li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs</li><li>Clear documentation <br><br></li></ul><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li> Salary ranging from $125k-$165k</li><li> On-boarding period to help the transition run smoothly</li><li> 401k with 4% company match. No waiting period for matching</li><li> Strong health/dental/vision packages offered</li><li> Unlimited PTO with flex time</li><li> Collaborative team environment</li><li> Unlimited growth potential with career path laid out</li><li> Performance bonus and equity.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Connor Whitman<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-062023-6071159</strong>

title: Enterprise Mobility IT Engineer II
description: <strong>Fullstack Java Developer</strong> <p>As a Full Stack Developer, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks, and third-party libraries. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility.</p> <p>If you're also familiar with Agile methodologies, we'd like to meet you.</p> <strong>Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions</li> <li>Design client-side and server-side architecture</li> <li>Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design</li> <li>Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications</li> <li>Write effective APIs</li> <li>Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency</li> <li>Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade software</li> <li>Create security and data protection settings</li> <li>Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design</li> <li>Write technical documentation</li> <li>Work with data scientists and analysts to improve software</li><br></ul> <strong>Requirements and skills</strong> <ul> <li>Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role</li> <li>Experience developing desktop and mobile applications</li> <li>Familiarity with common stacks</li> <li>Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)</li> <li>Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)</li> <li>Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache), and UI/UX design</li> <li>Excellent communication and teamwork skills</li> <li>Great attention to detail</li> <li>Organizational skills</li> <li>An analytical mind</li> <li>Degree in Computer Science, Statistics or a relevant field</li><br></ul>

title: CNC Programmer
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Doing</strong><p><br></p>The Senior Analyst, Quality Assurance is responsible for monitoring and assessing the quality of services provided CIBC contact centres. The role applies comprehensive knowledge and skills to improve the customer experience through observation, documentation, trend analysis, and performance appraisal . The Senior Analyst, Quality Assurance makes decisions on their own work methods, using established criteria to provide analytics and reporting in support of the ongoing enhancement of the client experience, and supports small to medium sized operational efficiency projects. The role exercises independent judgement within defined procedures to solves business, operational, and technical problems within the scope of their job.<p><br></p>Reporting to the Change Initiative Governance Testing Lead, the Sr. Analyst, Change Initiative Governance Testing is accountable for performing Quality Assurance assessments of change initiatives and projects across the Combined US Operations (CUSO) to assess adherence to change management policies, standards and processes. The Governance Testing analyst is also responsible for partnering with project/program managers to review testing results (quality assurance) and determine any remediation if necessary.<p><br></p><strong>Who You Are</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3-5 years of experience in Quality Assurance / Quality Control or testing programs</li><li>Bachelor’s degree required</li><li>Experience in Quality Assurance / Control or testing programs and Risk Management</li><li>Experience in Change Management and Program Management</li><li>Knowledge of business units and project management processes</li><li>Knowledge of project methodology, management tools and techniques; strong understanding of the banking industry preferred</li><li>Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite</li><li>Critical thinking ability, analytical and detail-oriented</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills and effective communication with cross-functional stakeholders </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What CIBC Offers</strong><p><br></p>At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client and to do it well. As part of our team, you will<strong>:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and home.</li><li>Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure foster innovation, collaboration, and creativity.</li><li>Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training.</li><li>Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits programs, retirement savings, and more.</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-120 S LaSalle St, 5th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Change Initiatives, Change Management, Operational Effectiveness, Project and Program Management, Quality Assurance (QA), Trend Analysis
